column2: Role & responsibilities   EventIron is looking for a Marketing Project Manager for a full-time, hybrid position in a fast-paced startup environment. The Marketing Project Manager will be the single point of contact and liaison between our customers stakeholders and the Marketing teams, including Creative, Content, Email, Performance Media, Sales Managers, BDR Leaders, RevOps & MarketingOps. The Marketing Project Manager will support the implementation and execution of creative/marketing deliverables and inbound/integrated/outbound campaigns by processing incoming project requests, assessing project needs, coordinating day-to-day project workflows, and providing client updates.  Run kick-off and check-in calls with clients cross-functional teams including stakeholders and contributors Break down silos by communicating across teams to push cross-functional projects to completion Drive stakeholder, approver, and contributor accountability through the relentless enforcement of due dates and effective escalation to leadership Autonomously lead multiple projects, including demonstrated ability to meet commitments, build consensus, negotiate resolutions, and garner respect from other teams. Translate project vision into clear and actionable tasks, ensuring the creative teams have a comprehensive understanding of expectations. Collaborate with Internal EventIron to maintain applicable resource relations. Advise team leads and business stakeholders on key milestones, project updates, and forecast project risks along the project lifecycle. Drive the approval process through appropriate channels to ensure project objectives and timelines are achieved. Lead project scheduling to avoid last-minute projects and rush points, keep project owners apprised of status. Proactively seek out best practices to improve consistency and effectiveness for a seamless project execution. Stay informed of current project management tools and industry standards to achieve efficiencies and streamlined processes. Regularly evaluate and identify shifts in our methodology to drive more efficiency, clearer communication, and more predictable project results   Preferred candidate profile     3-5+ years of experience in a Project Management position, PMP certification preferred. Experience working and thriving in enterprise technology company  4+ years experience maintaining cross-functional projects in a project management platform, preferably Jira and using waterfall methodology Clear understanding of and experience with sprint/scrum project management methodologies and the DACI framework. Work with a high level of accuracy and a sense of project ownership. Must work in a USA time zone (PT). Attention to detail with a willingness to change plans as needed Ability to "push back" on stakeholder expectations when they don't line up with bandwidth or budget constraints Clear written and verbal communication with the ability to synthesize and summarize key points effectively Ability to work with people of diverse backgrounds, roles, and personalities. Ready to work in night shifts   Perks and benefits

column2: Role & responsibilities     Company Description Silver Touch Technologies Ltd specializes in implementing digital transformation for enterprise customers, offering services on artificial intelligence, machine learning, big data/analytics, and robotic process automation. The company builds large enterprise applications on mean stack, Microsoft, open source, and cloud technologies like Azure and AWS, and also assists software product and SaaS companies with application building, upgrading, and support. Silver Touch holds certifications in CMMi level 5 quality standards, ISO 27001 information security standards, ISO 20000 service delivery, and ISO 9001 quality standards. The company serves various verticals, including internet/software, pharmaceuticals/healthcare, manufacturing, textile, omni channel experience, and government/public sector. We are looking for a seasoned SAP Support and Enhancement Specialist to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 10 years of relevant experience in SAP support and enhancement, with a strong background in modules such as MM and either PS, PM, FICO. The candidate should hold a minimum of two SAP certifications in MM and any of the aforementioned modules. As a Senior SAP Support and Enhancement Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the stability, scalability, and efficiency of our SAP systems while driving continuous improvement initiatives to enhance functionality and meet evolving business needs. Key Responsibilities: Provide expert-level support for SAP systems, including troubleshooting and resolving issues, performing root cause analysis, and implementing effective solutions to minimize downtime and disruptions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design enhancements, and implement changes to SAP modules in alignment with business objectives. Lead and participate in the planning, execution, and documentation of SAP system upgrades, patches, and enhancements, ensuring minimal impact on business operations. Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation, including system configurations, processes, and procedures, to support knowledge sharing and facilitate training for end-users. Proactively identify opportunities for process optimization and automation within SAP systems, leveraging industry best practices and emerging technologies. Stay abreast of latest SAP releases, features, and trends, and evaluate their potential impact on our systems and business processes. Qualifications : Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Minimum of 10 years of hands-on experience in SAP support and enhancement, with a focus on MM and at least one of the following modules: PS, PM, FICO. Strong understanding of SAP ERP architecture, modules, and integration points, with a proven track record of successfully delivering complex SAP projects. Proficiency in SAP implementation methodologies, such as ASAP or Activate, and experience with SAP Solution Manager is desirable. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, with the ability to effectively interact with stakeholders at all levels of the organization. SAP certifications in MM and one additional module (PS, PM, FICO) are required. Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment. Join our team and become a key contributor to our success as we continue to leverage SAP to drive innovation and growth. If you are passionate about SAP and possess the skills and experience outlined above, we encourage you to apply and be part of our journey towards excellence.

column2: The Senior Project Manager role will assume overall project management responsibility for delivery of technical transfer (site transfer), API change, reformulation, and process improvement projects. This will encompass effective planning, risk analysis, management, reporting and delivery of these projects on time and within the agreed budget.                             ?             What You ll Do:                         Overall management responsibility for the assigned project in line with agreed business strategies, objectives, and project milestones.                             Lead the project feasibility assessment in consultation with finance colleagues and ensure that a timely decision is reached on the project fate in consultation with the line manager.                             Engage with and form relationships with key internal stakeholders (regulatory, supply chain, artworks, quality, technical etc.) and external stakeholders (CMO, consultants etc.) early in the project lifecycle.                             Set up and chair regular and frequent cross functional project team meetings. Ensure good meeting practice with application of clear/structured agendas, minutes, and actions.                             Regularly track and report on project status and provide updates in a timely fashion by updating the status in project management system. Represent in various internal forums to update on the status of the project.                             Maintenance of database to capture progress, plans, risk, issues, and milestones for the whole new projects pipeline.                             Escalate risks / issues appropriately to remove barriers to success or advise of delays and other changes.                             Periodic review of project budget ensuring that the spend is in line with the approved budget.                              Propose improvements or alternative approaches to obtain improved project deliverables.                              Other tasks as delegated by Line Manager which contribute to overall running of the business unit.                               About You                                       ?               We are looking for highly motivated individuals who are passionate about making a meaningful difference to patients lives.                                        ?                 Qualifications:                         Graduate with Chemistry/Life science/Pharmacy; or other technically relevant graduate level qualification.                     Recognized project management qualification such as Prince 2 practitioner, PMP is desired.                     Knowledge, Skills & Experience:                     Must possess Hands-On experience in managing the global technical operations/scientific projects end-to-end in varying complexity.                     Must have worked for a significant period in a technical role (Production/QA/Formulation development, Analytical) within the pharmaceutical industry in regulated markets.                     Understanding of GMP requirements for pharmaceutical manufacturing operations.                     Excellent understanding of Technology Transfer requirements and awareness of the Regulatory and Supply Chain functions and their constraints.                     Understanding of the Drug Development Lifecycle and awareness of the Regulatory and Supply Chain functions and their constraints.                     Good working knowledge of Microsoft Project.                     Ability to work under pressure and to tight time deadlines. Track record of launching products on time.                     Good Presentation, Analytical (data rational) and Planning skills.                     Extensive experience working in a fast paced, dynamic organization.                     Fully conversant with IT systems used in the business across a wide range of business areas (SAP etc.)                     Excellent interpersonal, communication and organizational skills, Influencing / Assertiveness.                     Persists with challenging situations - does not give up despite barriers and obstacles.                     Ability to demonstrate strong Project Management skills on time delivery of actions from cross functional teams, timely resolution of issues and excellent budgetary control.                       A positive and can-do approach     , biased towards finding solutions and embracing change.                         Inspired by our values of entrepreneurship, speed and integrity.                         Learning agility and scalability , with a desire to continuously improve and develop as ADVANZ grows.                         Work collaboratively across all business functions with an open, honest, and respectful cooperation.                         Ability to have fun and thrive in a growing, unique, and inclusive work environment.

column2: Project Planning and Strategy: Develop and implement project plans, including defining scope, goals, deliverables, timelines, and resource allocation. Strategize the approach to accomplish project objectives efficiently.              Team Management: Lead and coordinate project teams, providing direction, guidance, and support to team members. Delegate tasks appropriately and ensure that everyone understands their roles and responsibilities.              Stakeholder Communication: Serve as a primary point of contact for stakeholders, including clients, executives, and team members. Maintain regular communication to provide updates, gather feedback, and address concerns.              Risk Management: Identify potential risks and issues that may impact the projects success. Develop mitigation strategies and contingency plans to address these risks effectively.              Resource Management: Manage project resources, including budgets, staffing, and equipment. Ensure that resources are allocated efficiently and effectively to support project activities.              Quality Assurance: Monitor project progress and deliverables to ensure they meet quality standards and adhere to project requirements. Implement quality assurance processes and procedures as needed.              Conflict Resolution: Address conflicts and challenges that arise during the project lifecycle. Facilitate resolution and maintain a positive and productive working environment within the project team.              Reporting and Documentation: Prepare and distribute regular progress reports, status updates, and other project documentation. Keep stakeholders informed about project milestones, achievements, and challenges.              Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements and best practices within the project management framework. Implement changes to enhance project efficiency and effectiveness.              Compliance and Governance: Ensure that the project complies with relevant regulations, policies, and standards. Adhere to organizational governance processes and guidelines.              Training and Development: Provide guidance and support to team members, helping them develop their skills and capabilities. Offer training and professional development opportunities as needed.              Post-Project Evaluation: Conduct post-project reviews to assess the projects performance, identify lessons learned, and gather feedback for future improvement initiatives                          Skill/ Competencies                  Technical: Communication Skill , Team Management      Functional: Legal Acumen      Behavioural: Project Planning and coordination          JOB SPECIFICATIONS:      Years of Experience: 17 To 19 Years          Qualification: BE/B.tech

column2: This role is part of Arcadis Global Excellence Centre (GEC) and will join our 3,000+ talented individuals working in India, Romania, and Philippines, in partnership with Arcadis offices globally      The GEC brings key capabilities and capacity to support our clients seamlessly around the world      For those in GEC there are options to be dedicated to one country; developing deep knowledge and strong relationships, as well as opportunities to be part of teams working truly globally as a centre of excellence, offering diversity and variety      Arcadians are by nature, globally minded and culturally aware, and Arcadis strongly believes in flexibility which enables change over time as your career progresses      The GEC model is well embedded in Arcadis, and the strong relationships that exist between our global offices are truly unique          Role accountabilities:          Proficiency & understanding of Project Management tools and the procedures to be followed that make process efficient.      Providing services from the Pursuit-to-win stage to Deliver-to-result as per Arcadis Way principles.      Apply technical methods and expertise to complete tasks to a professional level and interpret the established policies to effectively support client requirements / project scope.      Contribute to a range of assignments by undertaking practical tasks, monitoring, and reviewing work undertaken by more junior colleagues and work with senior colleagues to ensure programs of work are undertaken and project milestones are met.      Co-ordinate with Task Managers / Team Leaders within the GEC to ensure high-quality information and effective communication to the internal or external client.      Collaboration with PMO team by adding our insights and experience to arrive at efficient management tools.      Interpret data and prepare supporting documentation, making straightforward recommendations to support junior and senior colleagues in their decision-making process.      Primary focus will be providing support at Pursuit-to-win (PtW) in updating opportunities in Oracle Sales Cloud (OSC).      Mentor and train the junior level staff during and after the on-boarding of staff in a smooth and effective manner.      Develop and prepare any specific reporting requirement of Project Managers, Power BI & Project Health reports.      Closely monitor all aspects of Project Management for live projects and advise Project Manager(s) of progress and trends on spends, Multipliers & Project reviews.      Willingness to learn and adapt new tools and system/processes.          Qualifications & Experience:          Must have a bachelors degree in commerce, preference will be given for masters in business administration      6+ years related experience in Project accounting, Project Management & Project co-ordination      Based on project requirements, should be available to support region Project Managers      Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English is mandatory.      Knowledge in Project Management, Project accounting, Project Coordination

column2: The responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to, the following:          Effectively manage the design, construction, and start-up of capital projects in India (typically $1 - 30MM USD). Projects include the construction of new facilities as well as the upgrade and expansion of existing facilities.      Prepare project scopes, cost estimates, authorization requests and schedules along with basic engineering and detailed design construction packages      Coordinate and lead both internal / external members of project team along with contract engineering / construction management firms      Achieve required project completion schedule within authorized funding amount and meet all project performance goals (safety, quality, capacity, etc.)      Anticipate and identify areas of project risk and mitigate through proactive risk assessments and implementation of countermeasure / mitigation strategies      Accurately control, forecast and report project monthly capex and fiscal year spend      Responsible for EHS and compliance during project execution      Ensure all local government and Ashland requirements are met on project application, execution, and acceptance      Complete proper project close-out by establishing punch lists and acceptance protocols, preparation and checking of as-built drawings, cost and project reconciliation and take part in the lessons learned session      Effectively communicate project status to stakeholders and senior leadership via steering team meetings and other communication updates              In order to be qualified for this role, you must possess the following:          A minimum bachelor s degree in a relevant engineering discipline      A minimum of 7 - 10 years experience in managing capital projects in the chemical, pharmaceutical, food or heavy manufacturing industries      Proven ability to successfully design, construct and commission capital equipment and systems as part of projects in operating facilities      Project scheduling (MS Project, Primavera, etc.), cost control and cost forecasting skills      Demonstrated SAP or equivalent experience      Working understanding of P&IDs along with a basic understanding of industry and governmental standards for design and construction      Excellent computer skills with working knowledge of MS Office Suite      Strong organizational, communication and leadership skills, including a demonstrated ability to lead multi-discipline teams and motivate others              The following skill sets are preferred:          Master s degree in a relevant engineering discipline      Additional formal Project Management certification (e.g., PMI or CII)      Corporate-level large project management experience      Capital project estimating skills      Knowledge of international codes and standards      Hands-on field experience in chemical manufacturing facilities with process and equipment commissioning, safety reviews, performance testing, and troubleshooting

column2: Project managers will work closely with Stakeholders and the Executive Council Team to make sure that the scope and direction of each project is on schedule. Project manager is also responsible for the direction, coordination, implementation, executive, control and completion of project, while remaining aligned with strategy, commitments and goals of the organization. Job Description: Planning Project Resources: Making a feasible plan that achieves the goals and objectives of the project and aligns with the organizations overall business strategy which is an integral and critical part of the pitch to get approval for the project. Part of the plan will also be to define the projects scope and determining what resources are available, estimating time and financial commitment, as well as how to monitor and report on the projects progress. Time Management: Ensure everyone is doing what they need to do when they need to do it, the project manager must also define, schedule and accurately estimate the task duration to develop and maintain a realistic schedule. Budget: Present an estimated budget for the project in line with the business goals. Next, the Project Manager must monitor the actual spend as compared to the planned budget. If those figures are off, it must be revised / adjust accordingly. Quality and Satisfaction: Deliver to your stakeholders what they expected or better and make sure that theyre satisfied with the results. Need to be in constant communications with Stakeholders, reporting on progress and being open to their feedback to keep them happy and coming back to you with future projects. Manage Issues and Risk: Problems will inevitably arise in a project. Thats called an issue. You need to be ready for them and work towards resolving them quickly, so as they don?? take your project off-track. Then there are risks, which are potential problems, ones that have yet to occur or might not ever. Regardless, you must figure out beforehand what the risks are and set in place a plan of action if they in fact occur. Monitoring Progress: To make sure a project is progressing as planned, you must constantly measure it and compare those metrics against the plan you created. Therefore, you must have a way to collect project data, such as status reports, to see if the actual progress of the project is meeting what you had initially planned. Things are going to change along the way, and you??e going to have to adjust or reallocate resources to accommodate these changes.  Reporting and Documentation: Reporting is one of ways you communicate with your team and stakeholders as they are looking for broader data to check the project?? progress, both are essential tasks for the project manager. This documentation, along with all paperwork, must be collected, signed off on and archived by the end of a project, which provides a history that you can revisit when planning for a similar project in the future.   Education & Experience: Engineering Degree in a construction-related field, such as building science, jetty, ports, bridges construction & management or civil engineering, as opposed to just having industry experience. Project management qualification - PMP certification is mandatory

column2: The project manager roles and responsibilities may differ from one project to another. In fact, it may even differ based on company size and industry. However, these are some of the most common project manager duties for any company         Ensure all projects are delivered on time within the stipulated scope and budget         Lead the initiation and planning of a project and ensure technical feasibility         Ensure resource availability and allocation         Develop a detailed plan to monitor and track the progress of the project         Coordinate with internal and external parties for the flawless execution of projects         Manage relationships between clients and stakeholders         Measure project performance using appropriate project management tools         Perform risk management analysis to reduce project risks         Report and escalate to upper management as and when needed         Create and maintain a comprehensive project documentation       Qualification Requirements:           Most project managers get their career start as software engineers, marketing experts, or even sales reps. A successful project manager usually has five or more years in a relevant field with several formal qualifications for a project manager         Gaining the top project management qualifications is key for project managers to be successful within their roles         Here are a few must-have project management qualifications:       (1)    A bachelors degree in IT, computer science, business management, or a related field       (2)    Any relevant project management related experience       (3)    A Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is preferred       Skills:       There is no such thing as one general project management skill set that fits all. To lead a successful project, a project manager needs to be skilled in almost all fields - from tech to human resources, from marketing to construction and everything else in between. It s a complex but rewarding field.     Here are some of the most sought-after skills that successful project managers must have.         A solid understanding of business cases and risk management processes         Strong leadership skills         Proven self-management and team-management skills         Ability to monitor and control project budgets         Capability to make decisions under pressure     A project manager also needs to have great social and communication skills as well. Their duties will range from being a team leader, a supervisor, and a co-worker, all at the same time. They will also be the first person that the team goes to whenever there are any problems regarding the project.

column2: Position Overview: OffLens Design is seeking a Project and Delivery Manager who is adept at managing the nuts and bolts of design projects while ensuring that our clients feel uniquely valued and understood. This role demands meticulous attention to project timelines and budgets, direct communication with clients, and hands-on coordination across design teams. If you are detail-oriented, proactive about problem-solving, and committed to delivering high-quality work on or before deadlines, this could be the role for you. Role Summary Position: Project and Delivery Manager Experience Required: 3-8 Yrs Location: Hybrid/Delhi Shift: 12 Noon - 9 PM IST or 1 PM - 10 PM IST Working Days: Monday to Saturday, 6 days working  About OffLens Design At OffLens ( offlensdesign.com ), we pride ourselves on being a boutique design studio dedicated to supporting ambitious founders and entrepreneurs. As a part of our early-stage team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our future and contributing to exciting, impactful projects.  Our Culture We're not just looking for employees; we're in search of winners. Our environment is one that demands excellence and fosters personal growth. We value autonomy, and though we are a remote-first team, we thrive on a blend of synchronous and asynchronous collaboration. We expect our team members to be self-motivated, goal-oriented, and equipped with a genuine desire to exceed expectations. Key Responsibilities: Resource Management:  Actively monitor the workload and capacity of the design team to optimize resource allocation and maintain high productivity. Adjust assignments as necessary to balance team bandwidth and project demands. Project Allocation:  Assign projects to teams and individual designers based on their specific skills and current workload to best match project requirements with expertise. Timeline Adherence:  Set ambitious project timelines and hold the team accountable for early deliveries, ensuring projects are completed ahead of schedule whenever possible. Creating Delight Factors:  Develop and implement strategies that go beyond standard expectations to enhance the quality of deliverables. This includes ensuring all client interactions throughout the project cycle are positive. Continuous Upskilling:  Spearhead training initiatives to enhance the skills of the design team. Keep the team updated with the latest design trends and technologies, ensuring continuous improvement and competitive edge. Quality Assurance:  Personally review all work before it is sent to clients to ensure it meets the highest standards of quality and creativity. Post-Project Reviews:  Conduct thorough reviews after project completion to identify what was successful and what could be improved, applying these insights to enhance future project execution. Project Planning:  Develop detailed project plans that clearly outline key milestones and deliverables, ensuring all team members are fully prepared to meet project goals. Portfolio Management:  Maintain and update internal portfolio sheets that track project outcomes, client feedback, and team performance. Template Library Development:  Create and manage an internal template library to streamline workflows and reuse effective solutions from past projects. Risk Mitigation:  Identify and address potential project bottlenecks and obstacles early. Implement solutions to mitigate risks that could lead to delays or quality issues. Communication Excellence:  Maintain transparent and timely communication with both design team members and clients. Ensure all inquiries or concerns are addressed within ten minutes during working hours to uphold high standards of service. Crisis Management:  Respond quickly to any project crises or unexpected challenges, using a strategic approach to problem-solving that minimizes disruption and maintains project momentum. Brownie points if: Proven track record in project management specifically within the design industry or within any agency business.  Someone who has thrived in technology startups or other fast-paced environments.  Highly emotionally intelligent, crucial for managing both client relationships and internal teams effectively. Commitment to hard work, dedication, and a relentless pursuit of excellence are qualities we hold in high regard.

Requirement gathering for the customization if any on top of the premade products.                 Analyze project requirements and create detailed technical execution roadmaps.                 Estimate project timelines and identify potential risks and bottlenecks in advance.                 Develop checklists and testing menus for quality assurance processes. Software Project Manager Requirements               A bachelor s degree or master s degree in a related field                 Strong software development background with a solid understanding of various business domains                 Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills                 Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with technical experts, team members, and clients                 Proficient in creating and implementing projects, timelines and managing resources effectively                 Familiarity with software testing methodologies and quality assurance processes                 Familiarity with project management QA tools (ClickUp, Jira, etc.)             Soft Skills               Exceptional leadership and teamwork abilities                 Strong communication and interpersonal skills                 Customer-centric approach with a focus on delivering outstanding service                 Adaptability and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment                 Strong organizational and time management skills             You have very higher chances of grabbing this position:       If you have prior experience in software development and are now looking to switch to project management or QA. This role allows you to leverage your technical expertise while developing essential skills in project management and customer success. Join us to be part of a dynamic team, enhance your career growth, and contribute to the success of our globally recognized projects.             Recruiting Process at EnactOn       You re considering applying for a job. What happens nextLearn more about your upcoming recruiting journey.     1   Submit an application    Our recruiting team will review your application and take a follow-up within a week about whether we will look forward to your application.     2   Recruiter phone interview    The recruiter will set up a phone call to know more about you and answer your questions. You should not expect any feedback at this stage.     3   Assessment    You may receive a content assignment depends on the position you re applying for. It gives a better idea of what a job is like.     4   Face to Face Interview    You will interview with Enacters who have prepared to ask you thoughtful questions. It s only for the candidates who cleared the assessment.     5   Decision Stage    After a detailed brief, you receive an offer. If not, we provide candidates with thoughtful feedbacks for future interviews.     6   Onboarding    After you accept an offer, our recruiting team will guide you through the onboarding process.         Benefits and perks       Hardworking people who constantly add value to the company deserve great support. That s why we are maintaining flexible culture and exceptional learning experience for all our employees.   Intern development program    To get started, training and mentoring are essential to any college student. For every new hire, we have several structured internship programs designed to transform them into professional employees.   Decent payout    We do take care of employee s needs and value their importance. We offer a competitive payout, incentives bonuses. Our interns are getting decent pay as well.   Remote Work    You don t only need to be office or at a desk to show impact. You can choose to work from home or office with our hybrid working model.   Time off    We do believe in a healthy work-life balance. An assortment of leaves allows employees to enjoy some time off from work with their families and friends. Be it on vacation or sick leaves.   Fun stuff    We do not miss any treats, get together and celebrations. There is no shortage of fun when you work at Enacton. Work hard and party harder!         EnactOn         Other Job Openings     Technical Business Developer    1 Position     1-3 Years Experience   Project Manager    1 Position     2-3 Years Experience   Business Development Executive    1 Position     1-3 Year Experience

column2: As a software project manager, you will be responsible for managing a team of frontend, backend, and mobile developers, quality teams, Ai engineer, DevOps engineers, mid and junior project managers, and more       You will manage and work closely with the development teams to ensure that all software projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the required quality standards     You will also be responsible for managing the development process, from planning and design to implementation and deployment              KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:               Project Planning: You will work with stakeholders and team members to define the project goals, timelines, and deliverables. You will create a detailed project plan, outlining tasks, timelines, dependencies, and resources required.         Team Management: You will manage and oversee the software development team, ensuring they have the resources, tools, and support they need to complete their work on time and to a high standard. You will delegate tasks and responsibilities, monitor progress, and provide feedback and coaching to team members.         Budget Management: You will be responsible for managing the project budget, tracking expenses, and ensuring that the project is delivered within budget.         Risk Management: You will identify potential risks and issues that may impact the project and develop strategies to mitigate them. You will also monitor the project for potential risks and take proactive steps to address them.         Communication: You will communicate regularly with stakeholders, team members, and external partners to keep them informed about project progress, risks, and issues. You will facilitate effective communication between team members, ensuring that everyone is on the same page.         Quality Assurance: You will be responsible for ensuring that the software developed by the team meets the required quality standards. You will develop and implement quality assurance processes and procedures, conduct code reviews, and ensure that testing is thorough and effective.         Documentation: You will ensure that project documentation is complete, accurate, and up-to-date. This includes project plans, schedules, status reports, and other project-related documentation.         Continuous Improvement: You will continuously review and assess project performance, identifying opportunities for improvement and implementing changes to improve efficiency, quality, and overall project success.               EXPERIENCE:               Degree in Computer Science or related field.         3-5 years of experience in software project management         3+ years of software development experience          Proven experience as a project manager in a software development environment.         Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.         Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.         Familiarity with Agile development methodologies.         Experience overseeing software development using technologies like AngularJS, Nodejs, AWS, and Flutter.         An extensive understanding of Management Information Systems, software development, IT infrastructure, and relational database systems.         In-depth understanding and strong knowledge of the Software Develop Life Cycle (SDLC) and Jira.         Expert Experience Managing projects in Jira                   A PLUS IF YOU HAVE:               Start-up experience (we love entrepreneurs).         Knowledge of restaurant tech and operations

column2: We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Project Manager to oversee interior design projects from inception to completion     As a Project Manager, you will be responsible for collaborating with clients, subcontractors, and architects to ensure the successful execution of interior design projects     Your role will involve meeting client requirements, managing costs, coordinating design details, and providing regular progress updates     The ideal candidate will have a strong background in interior design, excellent communication skills, and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously         Responsibilities:         Meet with clients to thoroughly understand their needs, preferences, and any special considerations or concerns related to the interior design project.     Collaborate with clients to develop project objectives, timelines, and budgets, ensuring alignment with their expectations and constraints.     Manage materials and labour costs effectively to ensure projects stay within budget guidelines while maintaining high-quality standards.     Review and evaluate bids from subcontractors to ensure they are reasonable in terms of price, scope of work offered, and adherence to project requirements.     Coordinate design details with architects and other relevant stakeholders to align interior design plans with construction plans and ensure seamless integration.     Prepare progress reports for clients on a regular basis, providing updates on project milestones, budget status, and any issues or challenges encountered.     Monitor project progress, identify potential risks or obstacles, and proactively develop strategies to mitigate them, ensuring projects are delivered on time and within budget.     Oversee the execution of interior design projects, ensuring adherence to design specifications, quality standards, and industry best practices.     Foster strong working relationships with clients, subcontractors, and other project stakeholders to ensure effective communication and collaboration throughout the project lifecycle.     Stay updated on the latest trends, technologies, and industry practices related to interior design, incorporating innovative solutions and approaches into project management processes.           Job Requirement           Bachelors degree in Interior Design, Architecture, or a related field. Relevant certification or equivalent work experience is also acceptable.     Proven experience as a Project Manager in the interior design industry, with a strong portfolio of successful projects.     Exceptional organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously.     Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to effectively convey complex ideas and information to clients, subcontractors, and team members.     Strong negotiation and problem-solving abilities to handle project-related challenges and conflicts effectively.     Proficiency in project management software and tools to track progress, manage budgets, and communicate project updates.     Knowledge of interior design principles, materials, and construction processes, with an understanding of relevant building codes and regulations.     The detail-oriented mindset with a focus on delivering high-quality results within defined timelines.     Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and foster positive relationships with diverse stakeholders.     Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements and priorities.

column1: Project Manager/Customer Contract Manager - Gas Turbines
column2: The project management office Long Term Program & Overhauls is responsible for the customer care and the delivery of services to our gas turbine customers worldwide.      Our customers are mainly in Power Generation and Oil & Gas industry which is characterized by a high tempo and dynamic environment.      We are now recruiting a Customer Contract Manager (CCM) who shall support customers in the region Americas, Africa and Middle East.      You will on a regular basis visit your customers and regional Siemens Energy colleagues, which is why this position require some international travel        How You ll Make an Impact        You have full responsibility for your service contracts and act as wall-to-wall responsible for its execution and delivery.      You lead a multi-functional project team with colleagues from other subject areas in our service organization, such as engineering, commercial project management, overhaul project management and more.      You are the customer responsible, where trust, clarity and communication are important key words.      You build long term relations and insights of your customers needs, decision-making paths and key collaborators. You also build strong relations with our Siemens Energy regional colleagues and together you succeed in delivering our commitment to our customers.      You identify the customers needs as well as promote our service products and find opportunities for additional sales.      You structure and plan activities within the contract on time and in accordance with the requirements of the customers.      You are prepared to travel to negotiate and follow up your contracts together with our local representatives.        What You Bring        Previous experience of international business, such as sales or project management.      Strong negotiations skills, you are confident in your communication at different levels and enjoy delivering under pressure.      Team spirit and strong collaboration skills with different people and cultures.      A can-do approach and knowledge how to act proactively.      A strong drive and commitment that will make a difference every day.      An understanding of advanced risk and opportunity management      Qualifications      Minimum Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience in Mechanical Engineering or Equivalent from a recognized University.      Masters or equivalent experience to Certificate in Business Administration is preferable.      12 - 15 years of proven experience in Project Management activities from Oil & Gas/Energy/Power Generation industry preferably with Gas Turbines      Experience on Long Term Projects (LTP) and Projects of Modernization and Upgrades (Mods & Ups) related to Gas Turbines      Certified Project Manager (e.g. IPMA or PMP).      Hands-on experience on PM tools like MS Project/One PM      Knowledge in SAP and Salesforce.

column2: Technical Project Manager  Work Location: Noida Work from office Position Overview:   We are seeking a highly skilled  Technical Project Manager t o join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background combined with excellent project management skills to drive successful project execution from initiation to closure. Key Responsibilities: Project Planning and Execution:  Define project scope, goals, and deliverables; develop detailed project plans; allocate resources and monitor progress to ensure timely completion of projects. Stakeholder Communication:  Maintain regular communication with stakeholders to provide updates on project status, address concerns, and manage expectations. Risk Management:  Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure project success; monitor and manage risks throughout the project lifecycle. Team Leadership:  Lead and motivate cross-functional teams; foster a collaborative environment; provide guidance and support to team members to ensure project objectives are met. Quality Assurance:  Ensure deliverables meet quality standards and comply with project requirements; conduct thorough testing and validation as needed. Budget Management:  Monitor project budgets; track expenses; ensure projects are completed within allocated budget constraints Documentation:  Maintain comprehensive project documentation; create reports and presentations for stakeholders; ensure all project artifacts are well-documented and accessible. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field; Masters degree or PMP certification is a plus. Minimum of 7 years of experience in technical project management. Strong understanding of software development lifecycle (SDLC) and Agile methodologies. Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. Proven track record of successfully managing complex technical projects from initiation to closure. Proficiency in project management tools such as JIRA, Trello, or Microsoft Project. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities. Please share the following details along with the most updated resume to geeta.negi@compunnel.com if you are interested in the opportunity:  Total Experience  Relevant experience   Current CTC   Expected CTC   Notice Period (Last working day if you are serving the notice period)  Current Location  SKILL 1 RATING OUT OF 5  SKILL 2 RATING OUT OF 5  SKILL 3 RATING OUT OF 5 (Mention the skill)

Practical experience of delivering projects in a mid-large organizational setting 2). Strong team-working attitude. Willing to share and seek information  3). Strong organizational and multitasking skills with ability to balance competing priorities  Perks and benefits

column2: Role & responsibilities   The Project Manager  (Grapes / Pomegranate / Horticulture Produce) will be responsible to manage the project and market linkage vertical of the program throughout the state. Specific tasks include: Build and maintain commercially viable partnerships between producers, exporters, processors, and buyers Develop and maintain business relationships with organized retail, institutional buyers, traders, and farmer groups to create sustainable marketing Facilitate long-term contractual relationships between FPOs, input service providers, and end-market buyers Design marketing, promotion, and branding activities Provide implementation-level support to the FPO on all marketing-related activities such as setting up aggregation systems, quality control, farmer training, processing, etc. Help establish business linkages bringing marketing connections as well as signed marketing contracts for products produced by the FPO members. Support and monitor compliance to all trade-related documentation such as APMC cess, VAT, entry taxes, waybills etc. Manage relationships with multiple stake holders including buyers, processing units, local APMCs, agriculture departments, NCDEX, etc. Help the FPCs with on-ground problem solving, including negotiating with vendors and service providers, liaison with the local government department etc. Support the Project Team, where required, on other thematic areas within the program. Support the project leadership in all reporting and compliance matters Any other project activity as the need arises or advised by project leadership team   Preferred candidate profile   Minimum of 11-15 years of experience in a similar position with extensive knowledge in the agriculture input sector and marketing of any of the commodity value in  Horticulture,   Cashews ,  Grapes ,  Raisins  or  Pomegranates . Demonstrated ability to work with a diverse team, spread across diverse geographies and to deliver in a time-bound program  Familiarity with other business disciplines such as finance, market research, sales, and planning Excellent communication skills (written and oral) and an ability to build a convincing argument.  Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and function independently Qualification: MBA/Masters in Agriculture / Marketing / Rural Development and related fields  Perks and benefits    Qualified and interested applicants should submit a word-formatted/pdf single document that includes a cover letter, resume and salary history to  sshankar@tns.org

column2: Job Summary:   We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Project Manager to oversee our Transmission Projects in Dimapur, Nagaland. The ideal candidate will possess a Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering (B.E/B.Tech), along with a minimum of 12-15 years of relevant experience in the field. The primary responsibility of the Project Manager will be to ensure the successful planning, execution, and completion of 220/132/33KV Transmission Projects within the specified timelines and budget constraints. Key Responsibilities: Project Planning and Execution:  Develop comprehensive project plans, including scope, schedule, budget, and resource allocation. Coordinate with internal teams and external      stakeholders to ensure timely execution of project milestones. Risk Management:  Identify potential risks and challenges associated with the project and develop mitigation strategies to minimize their impact on project timelines and budgets. Contract Management:  Oversee the preparation, negotiation, and management of contracts with vendors, suppliers, and subcontractors. Ensure compliance with contractual      obligations and regulatory requirements. Quality Assurance:  Implement quality control measures to ensure that all project deliverables meet the required standards and specifications. Conduct regular inspections and      audits to monitor the quality of workmanship and materials. Resource Management:  Manage project resources efficiently, including human resources, equipment, and materials. Allocate resources effectively to optimize productivity and      minimize wastage. Cost Control:  Monitor project expenses closely and identify opportunities for cost savings without      compromising quality or safety standards. Prepare regular budget reports      and forecasts to track project expenditures. Stakeholder Communication:  Maintain open and transparent communication channels with project stakeholders, including clients, government agencies, regulatory bodies, and local      communities. Provide regular updates on project progress, issues, and      challenges. Health, Safety, and Environmental Compliance:  Ensure compliance with all health, safety, and environmental      regulations and standards. Implement appropriate measures to mitigate      risks and hazards in the workplace. Team Leadership:  Provide strong leadership and guidance to project teams, including engineers,      supervisors, and support staff. Foster a collaborative and inclusive work      environment that encourages creativity, innovation, and continuous      improvement. Qualifications and Experience: Bachelor's degree in      Civil Engineering  (B.Tech/B.E) from a  recognized institution. 12-15 years  of relevant experience in project management, with a focus on  220/132/33KV Transmission Projects. Proven track record of successfully managing large-scale infrastructure projects from initiation to completion. Strong technical expertise in transmission line construction, substation development, and related civil engineering works. Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. Proficiency in project management tools and software. PMP or PRINCE2 certification would be an advantage.

column2: Scope: The Project Manager is responsible for the day-to-day management of the mold and tooling program for specific accounts. This position will be the lead contact for all projects related to management and care of our clients mold and tooling assets along with various other related projects. Ideal Candidate will have: ??7+ years engineering project management within plastics and/or related manufacturing industry ??Knowledge of mold and tooling engineering a plus. ??Capable of managing a team of engineers & multiple projects. ??Understanding of engineering practices and tools for managing engineering projects. ??Understanding of quality systems which contribute to ensuring the clients molds are in a state of readiness and have the ability to produce conforming parts in an ongoing basis. ??Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and MS-Projects.   ??Skills in Auto-Cad or Solid-Works is a plus.  Responsibilities & Duties: Plan and execute internal and external projects. Coordinate annual engineering reassessment(s) with the client suppliers and engineers. Advise the clients mold management team regarding manufacturing site visits for mold and tooling assessments. Coordinating and managing tooling work that requires the asset to be sent to a Tool Shop. Project Team Leader (PTL) responsible for following up on action items related to: Overseeing the work order process to ensure planned and unplanned tooling needs are met and quotes are loaded in COAST System, when required. Analyze and distribute Engineering Exit Reports to the client and COAST Teams. Communicate issues that require attention and/or funding related to mold / tooling health. Coordinate and initiate periodic calls with manufacturing sites to ensure readiness of mold and tooling assets at each supplier location. Coordinate and present tooling status reports during meetings with the client and COAST Leadership Teams. Function as Point Of Contact (POC) for suppliers and communicate internally and externally regarding work requests, funding requests, and quality and processing issues. Plan and manage engineering kickoff meetings between the client, manufacturer, and tool shop vendors for new mold and refurbishment projects. Coordinate and deploy Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Engineering assistance. Securing quotes for funds and purchasing requirements for mold and tooling assets. Provide quarterly budget and spending projections to the client and COAST Leadership

column2: With a focus on cutting-edge technologies and innovation, we are expanding our team and seeking an experienced Project Manager to join us in driving successful project outcomes and customer success.                ?         Responsibilities:             Develop comprehensive project plans, outlining project scope, goals, deliverables, timelines, and resource requirements.          Monitor project progress regularly, ensure on-time deliveries, and identify and address potential delays or issues.          Allocate resources effectively, balancing workload and ensuring optimal team efficiency.          Collaborate with clients to define project requirements and expectations.          Proactively address conflicts within project teams or with clients and maintain positive relationships.          Identify project risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure successful project outcomes.          Apply a strong understanding of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) principles and Agile methodologies to project planning and execution.              Generate various reports to analyze projects health and provide insights into key performance indicators.                              Qualifications           Minimum of 4 years of proven experience in project management, with a focus on IT projects.        Bachelors degree in a relevant field or equivalent education.        Proficiency in project management tools such as JIRA, Asana, Trello, etc        Familiarity with SDLC, Agile, and other project management methodologies.        Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.        Analytical mindset for data-driven decision-making.        Strong leadership and team management capabilities.                What We Offer:               A collaborative and dynamic environment filled with brilliant minds.          Competitive salary, benefits package, and other rewards and recognitions.          Excellent career and learning opportunities through conferences, trainings, and certifications with industry experts.          Leadership opportunities to drive organizational growth and work with Senior Management directly.

column2: We are seeking an experienced  Technical Project Manager  to join our team and oversee a diverse range of marketing tech and design projects for our global clients. The ideal candidate should have a minimum of 5 years of experience in project management for web CMS, mobile, search/social projects, and e-commerce development, with a focus on web and mobile technologies. As a Technical Project Manager , you will be responsible for managing projects with top-down oversight from initial development through implementation to ensure adherence to standards of scope, budget, and timeline. You will develop comprehensive project plans that merge customer requirements with company goals and coordinate various managers and technical personnel during all project phases. You will also monitor project progress continuously and provide reports on measurable items, such as milestones and deliverables. Prior Experience :  Minimum 5 Years in project management role. Location:  Kolkata (Rajarhat-Newtown ) Mode of working:  Work from office To Apply:  https://www.webspiders.com/career/technical-project-manager Requirements?- Experience in managing multiple projects across various technology stacks like PHP, Laravel, Angular, React/VueJS, Node, IOS etc. or CMS and e-com platforms like Drupal, WordPress, Shopify, Magento. Understanding of Search and Social Marketing methodologies. Provide help in understanding the functional requirements, suggest suitable technologies, provide help in finalizing a technical solution, extend a supporting hand for resolving any technical issues faced by the team members. Be able to work effectively in a multi-party solution delivery team including partners, vendors, clients and internal teams. Ability to work with the Sales / Pre-Sales / technology team to respond to RFCs / RFPs and design and deliver enterprise IT solutions. Experience in managing deliveries for Digital initiatives, such as development of Portal, Web application and Mobile App etc. Experience and knowledge of various SDLC (not restricted to Agile, V-Model and Waterfall) methodologies. Very strong team management, stakeholder management with strong problem solving, communication and time management skills. Innovative thought process to understand the client's pain points and provide targeted solutions to grow the account. Experience in managing Cloud/AWS/Azure projects. Experience in creating project plans and managing project budgets Project & Product Management Certification is a plus. Roles and Responsibilities - Manage projects with top-down oversight throughout entire execution to ensure success as defined by adherence to standards of scope, budget, and timeline. Develop comprehensive project plans that merge customer requirements with company goals and coordinate various managers and technical personnel during all project phases, from initial development through implementation. Monitor project progress continuously and make detailed scheduled reports on measurable items, such as milestones and deliverables. Communicate proactively with all involved personnel to provide encouragement, identify problems, create solutions, and implement efficiency improvements. Analyze economics of project plans and provide actionable feedback relating to cost benefit and return-on-investment standards. Review proposed modifications on project plans, including meeting with interested parties to approve and implement beneficial changes. Oversee acquisition of resources and materials as needed before and during projects by talking with customers, team members, managers, and in-house accountants and negotiating price and payment agreements with vendors. Anticipate details of future projects by communicating directly with customers and staying informed of relevant trends and industry news. Ability to identify various risks associated with the project spread across multiple phases of the project and provide a plan to mitigate those risks. Research and evaluate hardware and software technology options and weigh the cost/benefit analysis when making large purchases on behalf of the company. Perks and benefits  - Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses. Exciting and challenging projects at the forefront of technology. Process Oriented Appraisals Professional development opportunities and training. Rewarding Buddy-Referral Program Collaborative and inclusive work environment. Complimentary Breakfast, Evening Snacks & Subsidize Lunch at Office.

column2: We are looking for transformative SAP Functionals to join our Enterprise Apps Studio. We help businesses transform via augmented processes and the continual enhancement of their enterprise architecture. We provide the expertise to enable organizations to take advantage of the latest in machine learning and data science platforms and services. Come be a part of the team to transform, innovate and optimize. SAP Project Manager or Program Manager -  OurSAPS/4 HANA Sr.ProjectManagerwill work for a team chartered with the deployment ofSAPS/4 HANA for a large Medical Systems client in the US. This role is based out of India and is responsible for the delivery of this multi phased program. Duties include but may not be limited to: Own and deliver toSAPS/4 HANA Plans and schedules along with the US Transformation Team. Monitor, control Offshore Implementation Team and execution of the Team Plans and schedules, reporting issues, progress to the Transformation Leadership. Refine and implementprojectrelated standards, templates, and procedures. Ensure training of Team staff on the use of tools, templates, procedures, and standards as part of the S/4 HANA Deployment Effort Lead cross-functional teams to understand current state, future state landscape, organizational, master data and business processes and requirements. Lead configuration requirement efforts and work to ensure S/4 HANA settings meet customer requirements identified with customer. Lead development of functional specification activities and interface effectively with the Development teams to translate Functional Specification documentation into Technical Specifications and the development of technical designs Lead security teams to Identify local security requirements and the creation of necessary security profiles. Work with the onsite teams to organize conference room pilot events designed to demonstrate the system post build (Configuration and Development) activities to showcase the incorporation and validate requirements. Work with onsite PMO teams to plan and schedule participation of key stakeholders in testing activities. Provide leadership, guidance, and support duringmanagementof the execution of testing activities monitoring progress. Work with Training team so they develop necessary training materials. Work with Training Factory to understand training content as part of Train the Trainer sessions. Work with localmanagementto plan and schedule participation of key stakeholders in end user training activities. Work with Data Conversion team and Training team to plan and schedule cutover and go-live activities, identifying sequence of tasks, double entry, manual procedures, and load sequences involved. Manage Deployment-related cutover and go-live activities. Manage support post go-live, leading team to resolve post go-live issues. Skills Solid knowledge of system development methodology,projectmanagementand system architecture. Preferably involving the implementation of SAPECC or S/4HANA Solid analytical problem solving skills Agile Development methodologies such as Activate Ability to evaluate IT and business challenges from a broad perspective. Strong influencing and excellent communication skills. Ability to translate between non-technical business users and technical IT resources. Strong delivery focused Strong organizational and timemanagementskills Flexibility to work in shifts to support the client

column2: The Senior Integrated      Project Manager      is responsible for running creative and production processes and working alongside our existing talented Project Management team to drive a project from brief to delivery.          L      eading on projects while working with our dynamic teams across the business, our project managers successfully deliver projects following OLIVER+ ways of working.                              What Youll be Doing:                        GENERAL TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES      :                Have integrated experience across various disciplines which can include one or more of the following: Digital, Technology,      Film, CGI, Motion Design and/or Print      projects across different sized accounts and across different time zones; from initial brief to final delivery (based on experience)              Manage your team to deliver a wide range of deliverables from email marketing to website content              Strive to follow and implement the defined project management and production processes within OLIVER+ and with partners              Handle multiple projects simultaneously and thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment              Face adversity, setbacks and negativity with a resilient mindset and attitude              Embody the company values, instil these behaviours within all team members              Drive continuous improvement through each step of the process and consult on process improvements              Close off projects to set standards/requirements                      INITIATE & PLAN THE PROJECT:                Serve as the point of contact to receive new briefs and manage the process of transforming unclear briefs into well prepared briefs where applicable                  Manage the scoping, costing and planning of projects across different briefs                  Work to the OLIVER+ Project Management Way of Working while executing projects              Identify stakeholders and create a communication plan to ensure each of them has access to the right level of information              Set deadlines with partners and challenge unrealistic timelines to ensure workload is managed based on creative processes              Create project plan and identify key milestones for each of the projects you are assigned              Work closely with the Delivery Lead and Resource/Studio Manager to staff the project correctly based on the required deliverables and deadlines              Identify risks and possible issues and create risk registers                  Work closely with the creative team to define a cost, scope and timeplan for the projects              Prepare and run effective and structured client and team kick-off meetings              Create and manage the delivery of project documentation                      MANAGE PROJECT EXECUTION, MONITORING AND CONTROL:                Coordinate development and delivery among various project participants and stakeholders              Prioritize and manage workload of the project team              Partner liaison when required, presenting project scopes, cost estimates and timing plans              Build partner relationship and ensure their needs and requirements are addressed, while following the OLIVER+ ways of working              Monitor the progress of the project delivery within scope and budget with the planned resources              Prepare status reports for the stakeholders and actively manage the control of project progress using weekly action points              Follow the project management change control process for any changes needed in the scope, budget, timelines or resource requirement              Create and keep up to date all related project documentation and ensure compliance in the project management system              Proactively problem-solve, mitigate risks and plan for future issues              Be accountable for the financial profitability of the project and actively manage cost overburn and time logged daily              Ensure final deliverables are quality driven and comply to the design and production requirements and expectations              Monitor utilization and output of team                          What Youll Need:                  Willingness to accept feedback and iterate over processes in a highly-collaborative, low-ego team environment.              Process driven and continuous improvement mindset      .                  Curiosity, creativity, and ambition.                  Attention to detail      .              The ability to take a project from brief to completion, good communication, organizational, and time management skills are essential.                  Impeccable problem-solving skills and a love for client satisfaction.                  5+ years of experience and proven track record of successfully managed projects from start to end                  Strong communication skills.              Strong organisational skills - able to multi-task and manage multiple projects with different deadlines at one time.              Good eye for detail and quality control experience.              Software competency - Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Zoom, Teams and OMG (Oliver Marketing Gateway internal approval system - training will be provided).                          Youll Have:                    Relevant degree                  Fluency in English                  Proficiency      in Microsoft tools such as Excel, Word, Power Point, Outlook, Teams                  Experienced user of project management tools                  Familiarity with document sharing platforms such as SharePoint, Dropbox etc.                  Not essential but an advantage:                      Experience on global FMCG brands                  Multi-market experience                  International and multicultural exposure                      Good to have:                                  Agency/communication/production industry experience.                  Basic understanding and genuine interest in artificial intelligence (AI) technologies,      showcasing      a curiosity for exploring its applications and potential impact.

column2: We are looking for a Project Manager experienced in the U.S. Revenue Cycle Management industry, to assist in onboarding new clients and management of internal operational projects. The project manager will work closely with the CEO, Head of Operations and other stakeholders in delivery of projects towards execution excellence.  Role & responsibilities  :   Project manage new client onboarding right from Setting up the client account to Handing over to Operations team for BAU operations Coordinate and supervise the delivery of all company-wide projects from initiation to closure Ensuring efficient allocation of people, resources and equipment for assigned production projects Preparation and management of all project documentation Work closely with senior leadership to craft project plans, define scope and set targets Identifying project and operational risks, with mitigation measures instigated prior to commencement Coordinate between departments/functions to complete action points, facilitate collaboration Engage, inform, influence and negotiate with stakeholders to ensure commitment  Delegate tasks on the project to team members as necessary  Monitor and report on financials, risks, issues and progress towards milestones and deliverables  Actively coach and mentor teams where needed Serve as a point of contact for teams to ensure team actions remain in synergy Communicate with executives to keep the project aligned with their goals Perform quality control on the project throughout development to maintain standards expected Adjust schedules and targets as needed  Preferred candidate profile   Minimum 7years US Healthcare RCM experience Graduation not required, preferably experience in Project Management. Proven track record in project management and delivery Advanced IT/System skills, able to develop and tools and systems required to carry out the role Lean Six Sigma or Six Sigma Green Belt / Black Belt certification with hands-on work experience will be an advantage Strong business expertise in project planning and management Excellent Project Management Skills Excellent presentation skills Excellent customer handling skills Excellent communication skills Team player and conflict handling skill   Work Week: Monday to Friday Shift hours:  8.00am CST to 5.30pm CST (US) Other Features: Full-time US calendar applicable Interested candidates kindly send us your resume to careers@healthreconconnect.com

column2: Role & responsibilities     Risk Management lead responsible for Risk Management Strategy, implementation of Risk Framework, compliance, and reporting. The Risk lead will lead Risk team and manage resources for engaging with Project Management Team and Subject Matter Experts. Responsible for influencing, initiating, and establishing standard Risk Management practices across Portfolio, Programme and Projects to facilitate the delivery of projects to time, cost and quality and as aligned with client requirements. Key Accountabilities: Generate      Risk Management Strategy aligned with Industry best practice. Develop      and establish Risk Management standards, processes and governance attuned      with the Risk Management Strategy. Lead a team of Risk Analysts or Managers and provide support for their professional development including recruitment, motivating, and building capability of team members. Lead      in both qualitative and quantitative risk analysis processes to support      project delivery outputs. Provide      assurance standards, risk assessments, and enhance risk maturity to inform      investment decisions at Project Risk cycle. Develop      and interpret Risk Management data to generate insights including      establishing escalation process and reporting dashboards to the relevant      stakeholders.  Lead      collaborator with Project Teams and specialists to scope and advise on      Project, Programme deliverables. Provide      expertise in Risk contingency processes aligned to clients risk draw down      and change management. Taking      ownership and accountability in Stakeholder engagement including      facilitation, performance reporting to provide key messages and influence      decisions.  Implement      and establish suitable Risk software and tools. Create      risk management reports for tender submissions and funding approval,      detailing all risks, mitigation actions and overall costs. Review      and analyze tender submissions and provide expert professional advice to      the Project Managers on the quality of contractor risk management outputs. Preferred candidate profile     Excellent verbal and written communication skills and technique to maintain seamless collaboration with diverse stakeholders. Experience of Industry wide recognized Risk Management Framework. Strong risk management techniques in identification, assessing, mitigating, and monitoring risks in a project environment. A relevant Risk Management, Project Management, Business Management, or similar degree or an accreditation from Institute of Risk Management (IRM), Management of Risk (MoR) or Association of Project Management (APM) Experience in implementing Risk Management principles and practices within a Project Management Office (PMO). Practitioner Risk Manager; Qualitative and Quantitative Risk Analysis such as Quantitative Cost Risk Analysis (QCRA) Proficient in MS Office applications including work and Excel. column2: ClinicMind, the nation s leader in multi-specialty Electronic Healthcare Records (EHR) software and Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) services, is looking for a full-time Technical Project Manager     If you re excited to be part of a winning team, ClinicMind is a perfect place to get ahead               RESPONSIBILITIES        Oversee the entire lifecycle of healthcare products from concept through development, launch, and phase-out. Ensure products meet market needs and achieve clinical, operational, and financial goals.
