column2: As a Technical Project Manager, you will be responsible for leading the planning,   execution, and delivery of technical projects within our organization. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to define project scope, goals, and deliverables, while ensuring that projects are completed on time, within budget, and according to quality standards.         Key Responsibilities:           Project Planning and Initiation:         Define project scope, objectives, and deliverables in collaboration with   stakeholders.   Develop project plans, timelines, and budgets, considering resource   allocation and constraints.   Conduct feasibility studies and risk assessments to identify potential   project obstacles.         Project Execution and Monitoring:         Lead project teams in executing project tasks according to the defined   project plan.   Monitor project progress, track milestones, and ensure adherence to   project timelines.   Manage project resources effectively, including personnel, equipment, and   materials.   Identify and address issues or risks that may impact project delivery.         Stakeholder Communication:         Communicate project status, updates, and milestones to stakeholders,   including senior management.   Facilitate regular meetings and discussions with project teams to ensure   alignment and collaboration.   Address stakeholder concerns or requests promptly and effectively.         Quality Assurance and Control:         Implement quality assurance processes to ensure that project deliverables   meet specified standards.   Conduct regular quality reviews and inspections to identify and resolve   defects or deviations.     Monitor and enforce compliance with relevant industry standards and   regulations.         Change Management:         Manage changes to project scope, schedule, or budget, and assess their   impact on project objectives.   Evaluate change requests and implement appropriate change control   procedures.   Communicate changes to project stakeholders and ensure buy-in and   acceptance.         Documentation and Reporting:         Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including project plans,   schedules, status reports, and risk registers.   Generate regular progress reports and presentations for stakeholders and   project sponsors.   Document lessons learned and best practices for future reference and   continuous improvement.         Qualifications:         Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field.         Proven experience as a technical project manager, managing complex projects in a technology-driven environment.         Strong understanding of project management methodologies, tools, and techniques.         Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.         Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities.

column2: The Project Delivery Manager is responsible for successfully delivering gas panels for gas compressors in the Oil & Gas industry. This includes managing all aspects of the project from start to finish, including planning, execution, and commissioning. The Project Delivery Manager will work closely with customers, engineers, and suppliers to ensure that the project is completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.     ?     The Project Delivery Manager will also be responsible for leading and managing dedicated project teams and global cross-functional teams, performing project risk evaluation throughout the entire project lifetime, coordinating the resolution of any technical or commercial conflicts, acting as John Cranes single point of contact to support the customer for post-order activity through to project delivery, and maintaining a communication channel with the client OEM/EPC organisation.     ?     The Project Delivery Manager is responsible for achieving cost, quality, and delivery targets within the agreed project scope.               ?       Duties & Responsibilities         ?       Project Initiation:       - Partner with the Sales team for a comprehensive review of incoming orders and ensure timely order handover.     - Collaborate with Sales teams to clarify techno-commercial contract issues.     - Align the Sales, Engineering, and Manufacturing teams on project requirements.     - Ensure accurate maintenance of all related order documentation.       Stakeholder Management &; Communication:       - Coordinate a preliminary pre-KOM with primary stakeholders.     - Organize a KOM to ensure alignment of all stakeholders on project scope and timeline. - Ensure timely and effective communication with regional stakeholders.     - Regularly engage with involved EPC/OEM and communicate with their senior management when necessary.       Project Planning & Execution:       - Develop, maintain, and execute detailed project plans.     - Liaise with the Engineering team for timely generation and review of critical documents.     - Coordinate with customers for timely engineering reviews and approvals.     - Manage changes to original engineering specifications with proper documentation.     - Monitor the engineering approval process for adherence to schedule and quality.       Vendor and Procurement Management:       - Engage with Procurement and Engineering teams for vendors for technical alignment on project requirements.     - Collaborate with the Procurement team to prioritise and expedite the procurement process for long lead items.     - Oversee the review and approval process of supplier drawings and datasheets.     - Partner with Procurement and Engineering to update and align the Bill of Materials for manufacturing.       Manufacturing Coordination:       - Work closely with manufacturing teams to ensure projects are completed on schedule and within budget.     - Relay special manufacturing or dispatch instructions to the Operations team.     - Collaborate with Operations to update the Manufacturing Planning Schedule.       Risk & Budget Management:       - Monitor and control project budgets, ensuring costs remain within approved limits.     - Continuously perform project risk evaluations, taking corrective actions when necessary.       Quality & Documentation:       -Define and communicate quality and certification requirements for manufacturing.     - Maintain records of project correspondence and produce project close-out summaries. - Provide monthly reports on project status.       Continuous Improvement:   - Drive initiatives to enhance delivery processes and customer satisfaction.     - Work on the development of Project Delivery Management processes for the EMEA region.           ?       The Individual              What youll definitely need -         ?     Degree in a technical discipline: Mechanical or Chemical Engineering preferred.     12-15 years of experience in Oil &; Gas / Petrochemical projects, with five years as a Project/Contract Manager.     Strong technical knowledge of Turbo Machinery/gas panels for the Oil & Gas industry.     Experience with API 618/API692 and other relevant API/ASME standards     Ability to interpret complex project specifications and drawings.     Comprehensive understanding of basic finance.     Experience with project management tools and methodologies     Proficient in Microsoft suite     PMP certification or equivalent project management qualification. Exceptional communication, negotiation, and presentation skills; willingness to travel up to 30%.     Planning and Decision Making:     Ability to make quick decisions regarding complex project issues, reducing risk to John Crane and the customer.     Develop specific project plans to ensure successful delivery.     Empower project team members to make quick decisions to keep projects on track. Impact and Scope:     Critical project delivery role influencing the success of strategic, global projects valued at about 2-5 million GBP.     Working with all regions, internal and external customers. This role focuses on wet seal systems with the ability to learn gas panels and filtration.
column11: PMP, Project management, EPC, Project planning, Customer service, Project delivery, Techno-commercial, Machinery, Petrochemical, Monitoring

column2: As a Project Manager you will enable our development teams to work effectively together with the client and support our project operation. At its core, this is a servant leadership role who facilitates and supports our teams in delivering high value solutions to our customers. contributing to building an environment where continuous improvement of the product development process is in focus and where everyones common goal is to deliver outstanding software. RESPONSIBILITIES DELIVERY TEAM: Assist the team in the early identification of impediments and work accordingly with the organization and/or other teams in order to remove them or mitigate their impact to the product development process. Train and Mentor the team in the correct understanding of Agile values, principles and applicable frameworks, enabling the team to identify how to get most value out of them within the context of the project. Make effective and timely use of escalations to the account team and/or client when needed. Actively support team happiness through building an environment of trust, openness and safe experimentation. Coach clients Product Owner in process-related aspects. Actively engage in coordination efforts with other PMs from the engagement in order to build a cohesive execution strategy and collaborate as much as possible. Coach the team towards effective: Quality outcomes in terms of Product, Process and Technical implementation - with excellence in mind. Risk & Dependency management - with safety & effectiveness in mind. Metric management - with continuous improvement in mind. Communication & Reporting - with better visibility, assertiveness & transparency in mind. OPERATIONS - Set up teams together with Tech Lead by raising requests as needed, selecting team members based on project needs & engagement constraints and setting them up for success by building a shared understanding of the client expectations and engagement conditions. Actively look for opportunities of growth for Globants position within the client engagement and follow through accordingly to actually turn them into new business i.e. supporting proposals, contributing to forming new teams, etc. Keep financial forecasts updated on a weekly basis. Manage P&L effectively to comply with revenue and margin targets. Process billing accurately on a monthly basis - or as applicable for the engagement. Take timely care of project assignments & releases for team members. Manage team leaves/vacations requests helping the team to assess the delivery & financial implications and plan accordingly to avoid/mitigate impacts. Manage customer satisfaction through the regular submission of surveys and follow through corrective/improvement actions with the team as needed. Manage extra compensation bonuses for the team members as needed. Manage travel arrangements for team members as needed. Take care of team logistics in terms of properly & timely requesting equipment, software or any resource needed by the team. Keep a close record of contracts to make sure they are valid and fully executed at any point in time within the engagement timeframe. Prepare for and attend to project audits, hold discussions, and gettting to agreements with a constructive and value-driven mindset. EXPECTED TRAITS Leader Inspires others through embodying Globants and Agile values. Negotiator Creatively pursues and effectively presents win-win scenarios for client, team, and Globant. Client-oriented Through solid business acumen, builds empathy and cherishes maintaining a good relationship with the client, centered in value outcome. Attitude of transparency Brings disclosure & transparency to the business, fostering trust. Servant leader Empowers the team and is willing to get their hands on to get things done. Facilitative Leads & demonstrates value-add principles to a team while keeping things moving in the right direction and creating actionable outcomes. Communicative and Social Communicates effectively and respectfully. Proactive Passionate and high-energy. Continuous learner Care about learning new things and improving existing challenges. Organized Makes effective use of time and promotes timeboxing. Resilient Recovers from recurrent difficult situations with a positive and learning attitude. QUALIFICATIONS 5- 10 years of relevant experience in a software development or delivery organization working with agile teams. Demonstrating effective communication in written and spoken the English language is required. BSc in Engineering or a related discipline is strongly desired. Hands-on software development experience is a plus. Agile certifications is a plus.

column2: The      Sr. Project Manager     - Managed Services is primarily responsible for managing complex IT transition and transformation projects for Managed Services. As such the Sr. Project Manager drives all aspects of the project activity including collaborating and coordinating across AHEAD Managed Services and client business segments. Manages project scope, defines work plan, resource needs, timeline, and project deliverables. The Project Manager manages project resources to complete projects on time and within budget. Keeps project team and AHEAD leadership updated as to project status and risk factors. Ensures adherence to quality standards and reviews project deliverables for completeness.              Roles and Responsibilities         Executes all IT transition and transformation activities designated in support of the Managed Services organization.      Defines and manages project workstreams, schedules and leads workstream meetings, tracks action items, issues, and risks, and provide status updates.      Reviews operational processes and coordinates and authors communications.      Drives the development and execution of the project plan by working with the different project workstreams to define, sequence and estimate duration of project activities and duration of schedule to meet project objectives.      Manages all aspects of the project execution including scope, requirements gathering, risk assessment, project planning, change control and status reporting.      Manages the identification, resolution, and escalation of project issues and risks.      Plans and executes project communications to ensure timely and accurate distribution of information, documentation, and issue resolution to all appropriate team members.      Ensures adherence to AHEAD s standards, processes, and policies for all projects.      Acts as a customer advocate during client transition and transformations.      Develops and follows standard SOPs for all IT transition and transformation projects.      Documents ITSM processes, procedures, and other relevant information as a reference document for client stakeholders and AHEAD resources.            Qualifications          Understands and applies the principles, concepts, theories, and standards of IT Project Management using Waterfall methodologies.      Knowledgeable of industry project management best practices (i.e., Project Management Body of Knowledge - PMBOK).      Understands and applies the principles, concepts, theories, and best practices of ITIL.      Strong ability to independently manage medium to high risk, high complexity, and high visibility projects.      Works on assignments where considerable judgment and initiative are required in resolving problems and making choices, recommendations, or decisions.      Regularly exercises discretion and independent judgment on business matters.      Must be adept with the use of negotiation techniques to reach agreement when there are widely differing viewpoints.      Effectively facilitate interaction with executive level clients.      Excellent analysis, problem-solving, team, conflict management, and time management skills.      Assists with the development and implementation of process documentation.      Able to consistently set clear expectations, manage team performance, and build high morale among team members.      Successfully maintain confidentiality and carry out assignments that are sensitive in nature.          Experience and Certifications         5+ years of relevant IT Project Management experience (combination with ITSM experience preferred)      Project Management Certification (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2) preferred.      ServiceNow experience is a plus.      Strong verbal and written communication skills.      Demonstrate ability to manage project budgets and timelines.      Possess advanced skills in the use of project management software.

column2: As a Technical Project Manager, you will play a key role in planning, executing, and delivering technology projects within specified timelines and budget constraints. Your responsibilities will encompass overseeing the entire project lifecycle, from initiation to closure, while collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure successful project outcomes. You will need a strong technical background, excellent project management skills, and the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders.         ?       Key Responsibilities:         Project Planning and Initiation:         -Define project scope, objectives, and deliverables in collaboration with stakeholders.     -Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, resource allocation, and risk management strategies.     -Conduct feasibility studies and ensure alignment with organizational goals.         Technical Oversight:         -Provide technical leadership and guidance to project teams.     -Work closely with technical leads to understand project requirements and constraints.     -Ensure adherence to technical standards, best practices, and quality assurance processes.         Project Execution and Monitoring:         -Manage and coordinate project activities, ensuring timely and on-budget delivery.     -Monitor project progress, identifying and resolving issues and risks.     -Conduct regular status meetings and reports for stakeholders.         Stakeholder Communication:         -Facilitate communication between technical and non-technical stakeholders.     -Provide regular updates on project status, milestones, and potential risks.     -Address stakeholder concerns and expectations throughout the project lifecycle.         Team Leadership:         -Lead and motivate cross-functional project teams, fostering a collaborative work environment.     -Allocate resources efficiently and ensure team members understand their roles.     -Provide mentorship and support to team members, promoting professional development.         Quality Assurance:         -Implement and enforce quality assurance processes to ensure deliverables meet specified standards.     -Conduct regular project reviews and audits to assess compliance with technical requirements.     -Work with the team to identify and implement continuous improvement opportunities.

Team Coordination and Management:      Assemble and lead project teams, including elevator technicians, engineers, and subcontractors.     Assign tasks, set clear objectives, and provide guidance to team members.     Foster a collaborative and positive work environment to enhance productivity and project efficiency.         Project Execution and Monitoring:      Supervise and manage the execution of elevator installation or modernization activities. Risk Management:      Identify potential risks and develop mitigation plans to minimize project disruptions. Client Communication and Relationship Management:      Maintain regular communication with clients to provide project updates and address their concerns.     Build and maintain strong relationships with clients to ensure customer satisfaction.         Compliance and Safety:      Ensure that all elevator installation activities adhere to relevant safety regulations and industry standards. Documentation and Reporting:      Maintain detailed project documentation, including progress reports, change orders, and project records. column2: As a    Technical Project Manager at Taazaa   , you will play a pivotal role in managing team and designing solutions for your project management     You will be a key contributor to our development and PMO initiatives, ensuring that our systems are scalable, efficient, and maintainable             Why Join the Adventure           Fasten Your Seatbelt:    Buckle up for a career journey filled with twists, turns, and rapid acceleration. Impact Matters:    Every day, our team members make a tangible impact on Technical World and the lives of people around the world. Your contributions here wont go unnoticed.       Dynamic Dynamite:    Your work here wont just be another line on your resume. Youll be at the forefront of shaping an amazing journey in the career leaving an indelible mark.       Redefine Your Limits:    Throw away the rulebook and embrace a culture that thrives on pushing boundaries and breaking molds. Your creative genius will find its home here.       Innovation at Its Finest:    Dive into a world where creativity knows no bounds. Estimate work, cost, and plan delivery schedules, including tasks, milestones, and dependencies.     Monitor project progress, publish regular status reports and quality metrics, track risks and issues, and actively work to resolve or mitigate them.     Navigate teams through all phases of project delivery, ensuring exceptional technical solutions align with company processes and standards.     Facilitate technical problem-solving and escalations, maintaining project schedules according to sprints in Jira.     Provide technical project training to teams and serve as a technical mentor to team members.     Capture innovations, lessons learned, and success stories from projects, sharing them across the organization while leading developers with a balance of technical and soft skills.     Build strong software project development teams, focusing on individual and collective competencies.     Manage client interactions, translating requirements into deliverables for the development team.     Oversee the entire SDLC and project lifecycle, from inception to delivery, with minimal supervision.                   Why we will      you   :         BE/B.Tech/MCA with 8+ years of experience and a deep understanding of Java or dot net technologies, web development, architecture, configuration, deployment, and domain-driven designs.     Core programming skills in Java or dot net, including relevant frameworks and libraries, are essential.     Experience with modern web development technologies, such as HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, and front-end frameworks (React or Angular), is required.     Sound understanding of Agile development methods and leading software development teams in an Agile/Lean environment.     4+ years of experience required for this Technical Project Manager profile.     Proficiency in JIRA, Confluence, and MS Office Suite.     Certifications in Scrum, Agile, PRINCE2, or PMP are a plus.     Prior experience in account management and client relationship building, working closely with client executives, such as CIO, CTO, and PMO, is an advantage.     Strong project management and technical fundamentals to build complex enterprise software applications.     Ability to apply Agile and Lean practices to lead self-organizing teams and deliver software aligned with client requirements.     Hands-on experience with OOPS, Data Structure, and Test-Driven Development (TDD).     Must have completed at least 2-3 SDLC projects using relevant Java or dot net technologies and frameworks.     Familiarity with design principles and domain-driven design.     Go-getter attitude, ability to work independently, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.     Experience in preparing technical proposals, effort, and cost estimation.     Passion for continuous learning and staying up-to-date with project management trends, technologies, and tools.     In-depth knowledge of project health, critical path items, risks, and timeline impacts.     Ability to build positive team dynamics and client relationships, maintaining healthy and productive company communities.

Headquartered in Ahmedabad, India, we are driven by the mission to empower communities with clean and sustainable energy. Position Overview The Solar Project Manager is pivotal in driving the successful completion of solar power plant projects within India. This role encompasses extensive coordination with various stakeholders, meticulous management of project timelines and budgets, and stringent adherence to quality and safety standards. Candidates should possess robust project management competencies, in-depth knowledge of solar energy systems, and the capability to lead diverse teams across different geographical areas. Key Responsibilities: 1.  Project Planning and Execution: a. Formulate and implement detailed project strategies, timelines, and financial plans in collaboration with stakeholders. b. Supervise all project activities to guarantee on-time and within-budget delivery, consistent with the project's scope. 2.  Stakeholder Management: a. Act as the primary contact for clients, contractors, vendors, and authorities, ensuring project requirements are met, and any issues are swiftly resolved. 3.  Team Leadership: a. Direct and inspire the project team, including engineers, technicians, and subcontractors, ensuring high levels of cooperation and performance. 4.  Quality and Safety Assurance: a. Apply stringent quality control and safety protocols to comply with industry norms, regulatory standards, and best practices for solar power plant construction and operation. 5.  Budget and Cost Control: a. Monitor project costs, track budget adherence, and execute cost-optimization strategies to enhance project profitability. 6.  Progress Reporting: a. Compile regular reports and updates for stakeholders, emphasizing progress, key achievements, and opportunities for improvement. 7.  Technical Guidance: a. Offer technical direction on solar power systems, equipment procurement, installation methods, and best operational practices. Qualifications 1.  Educational Background: a. A bachelors degree in engineering, Renewable Energy, or Project Management. Master's degree or project/renewable energy certifications are beneficial. 2.  Experience: a. Minimum 7 years of Proven track record as a Project Manager, preferably with extensive experience in managing solar power projects. 3.  Technical and Managerial Skills: a. Deep understanding of solar power systems and the construction and operation of solar plants. b. Proficient in project management, including planning, budgeting, risk management, and quality and safety oversight. c. Demonstrated leadership with a history of guiding multicultural and cross-functional teams. d. Strong communication abilities, with expertise in negotiating and engaging with various stakeholders. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) 1.  On-Time Project Completion:  Commitment to meeting project deadlines. 2.  Budget Management:  Efficacy in maintaining budget integrity with minimal variances. 3.  Quality Standards Adherence:  Consistency in achieving and maintaining high-quality deliverables. 4.  Safety Record:  Diligence in maintaining a workplace with no accidents, emphasizing safety protocol adherence. 5.  Client Satisfaction:  Excellence in meeting or exceeding client expectations. Key Result Areas (KRAs) 1.  Project Planning and Coordination:  Establishing and executing comprehensive project strategies and resources to ensure project success. 2.  Resource Management:  Efficient utilization of human, financial, and material resources to maximize project effectiveness. 3.  Team Leadership and Development:  Building a skilled and motivated project team dedicated to innovation and excellence. 4.  Regulatory Compliance:  Ensuring all project activities conform to relevant laws and environmental standards. 5.  Contract Management:  Maintaining strong partnerships and contractual integrity with all subcontractors and suppliers. 6.  Communication and Stakeholder Engagement:  Fostering transparent and effective communication with all project participants. Travel Requirements This position may require frequent travel for project-related tasks, including site inspections, stakeholder meetings, and coordination efforts. Travel can be extensive and intensive, varying based on the project's phase and location specifics.

Coordinate the integration of third-party services into project plans, ensuring alignment with project requirements and objectives. Timely Execution:  Monitor & Implementation project timelines, milestones, and deliverables to ensure timely execution and completion of project objectives. Proactively identify and address any issues or delays that may impact project timelines, utilizing problem-solving skills and strategic thinking to keep projects on track. Budget Management:  Monitor project budgets and expenses, ensuring that projects are delivered within budgetary constraints and identifying opportunities for cost savings where possible. Risk Management:  Monitor project progress, Identify potential risks and issues that may impact project success, proactively address challenges as they arise, implement mitigation strategies to ensure successful project outcomes. Team Leadership:  Lead, motivate, and inspire project teams to achieve project goals and deliverables, fostering a collaborative and high-performing team environment. Continuous Improvement:  Identify opportunities for process improvement and innovation within project management practices, driving efficiency and effectiveness across projects. Key Skills and Qualification:  Bachelor's degree in engineering, preferably in fields such as petroleum engineering, chemical engineering, mechanical engineering. PMP certification is a plus.  Master's in Business Administration (MBA) or Master's in Project Management.  Proven experience in developing and maintaining comprehensive project documentation, including project plans, schedules, and status reports.  Demonstrated proficiency in conducting third-party inspections and certifications, ensuring compliance with regulatory standards and client requirements.  Strong coordination skills with the ability to coordinate activities among internal teams, third-party vendors, and external stakeholders.  Track record of successfully implementing project plans and ensuring adherence to timelines, budgets, and quality standards.  Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and ensure timely execution of project milestones and deliverables.  Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate with stakeholders at all levels.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify issues, evaluate options, and implement solutions.  Effective leadership skills with the ability to motivate and inspire project teams to achieve project objectives.  Ability to build and maintain positive relationships with clients, ensuring their satisfaction and retention.

column2: Project Planning: IoT Project Managers start by defining project scope, objectives, and requirements     They create a detailed project plan, including timelines, resource allocation, and a budget     Stakeholder Engagement: They identify and engage with key stakeholders, including clients, end-users, vendors, and cross-functional teams     Effective communication and collaboration are vital in IoT project management     Team Coordination: IoT projects often involve cross-functional teams, including hardware and software engineers, data scientists, and network specialists     Project Managers ensure that team members understand their roles and responsibilities and work cohesively toward project goals     Budget Management: IoT Project Managers are responsible for managing project budgets, tracking expenses, and ensuring that costs stay within the allocated budget     Risk Management: They identify potential risks and issues that may arise during the project and develop risk mitigation strategies     IoT projects may involve data security, privacy concerns, hardware failures, or integration challenges, so proactive risk management is crucial     Technology Expertise: A strong understanding of IoT technology is essential     IoT Project Managers need to comprehend sensor technologies, communication protocols, cloud computing, and data analytics     Vendor Management: Many IoT projects involve the procurement of hardware or software components from third-party vendors     Project Managers select vendors, negotiate contracts, and manage vendor relationships     IoT Platform Integration: They oversee the integration of IoT devices and platforms     This includes ensuring that data from sensors and devices is collected, processed, and analyzed efficiently     Data Management: IoT projects generate large volumes of data     Project Managers are responsible for data storage, security, and ensuring that valuable insights are extracted from the data
column11: IoT Project Manager

Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to effectively interact with clients, executives, and technical teams.             What you will do       :         As a Microsoft Dynamics 365 Technical Project Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the successful implementation of Microsoft Dynamics 365 projects. Leveraging your extensive technical expertise and project management skills, you will ensure that projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet the defined requirements. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including clients, developers, consultants, and stakeholders, to drive the successful deployment of Microsoft Dynamics 365 solutions.             Key Responsibilities       :             Project Planning and Management       : Develop and execute comprehensive project plans, including scope, timelines, resources, and budget allocation. Define project milestones and deliverables, ensuring adherence to project management best practices throughout the project lifecycle.           Requirement Analysis       : Collaborate with clients and stakeholders to gather and analyse business requirements. Translate these requirements into technical specifications and project deliverables. Identify any customization or integration needs and define the technical approach accordingly.           Solution Architecture       : Work closely with the technical team to design and architect Microsoft Dynamics 365 solutions that align with client requirements. Ensure scalability, performance, and adherence to best practices. Conduct regular technical reviews to monitor progress and address any technical issues or risks.           Team Coordination       : Lead and manage cross-functional project teams, including developers, consultants, and other stakeholders. Define roles and responsibilities, assign tasks, and provide guidance and support throughout the project lifecycle. Foster effective collaboration and communication among team members.           Risk and Issue Management       : Identify and proactively mitigate project risks and issues. Develop contingency plans to address any potential obstacles that may arise during the project. Monitor project progress, track project metrics, and communicate project status to stakeholders, ensuring transparency and timely reporting.           Quality Assurance       : Establish and enforce quality standards and best practices throughout the project. Conduct regular quality reviews and ensure adherence to coding standards, testing protocols, and documentation requirements. Perform thorough testing and coordinate user acceptance testing (UAT) activities.           Client Relationship Management       : Build and maintain strong relationships with clients and stakeholders. Provide regular project updates, manage expectations, and address any concerns or issues that arise. Ensure a high level of client satisfaction by delivering projects that meet or exceed their expectations.           Continuous Improvement       : Stay up to date with the latest Microsoft Dynamics 365 features, updates, and industry trends. Identify opportunities for process improvement and innovation within project management methodologies and technical implementations. Share knowledge and best practices with the team to enhance overall project delivery capabilities.               Qualifications      :           Bachelor s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field (master s degree preferred).             8+ years of experience in technical project management, specifically in implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365 or similar CRM/ERP solutions.             Proven track record of successfully managing and delivering complex technical projects within budget and timeline constraints.             Project management certification (PMP, PRINCE2, Agile, etc.) is highly desirable.             Strong technical acumen and understanding of software development lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies.             Analytical mindset with the ability to identify and mitigate risks, solve problems, and make data-driven decisions.             Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

column2: Manager - PMO, who will lead project execution to complete the work statement by identifying activities, resources, and events. This position requires a seasoned professional with a strong background in project management, a strategic mindset, and the ability to oversee the successful delivery of projects. Plan for risk Mitigation and opportunity; Tracks project performance, efficiencies, and productivity and capture lessons learned. Implement corrective actions to improve performance. Coordinating and communicating regularly with stakeholders. The candidate shall provide periodic updates on project progress, quality metrics, project summaries, and other related documents.         ?       Roles Responsibilities:          Develop and execute the PMOs strategic vision in alignment with organizational goals.     Oversee the organizations project portfolio, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.     Prioritize projects based on business goals, resource availability, and project dependencies.     Continuously evaluate and enhance project management processes for efficiency and effectiveness.     Implement best practices and methodologies to streamline workflows.     Identifies risk and opportunity potential, develops mitigation planning, and refines the business case.     Facilitates and ensures integration of project/program plan, schedules, change and baseline management, processes, techniques considered to be best practice across the industry.     Establish and enforce project governance standards, ensuring compliance with organizational policies and industry regulations.     Acts as primary project contact to establish key stakeholder requirements and project objectives. Expertise in determining processes for accomplishing goals, including documentation, resource management, and related activities.     Capacity to break down and combine tasks into efficient workflows, identifying opportunities for synergy and integration, and simplifying complex processes.     Proficient in Project Management theory, encompassing critical concepts like project risk management, project scope management, and the project management lifecycle.     Capability to direct, delegate, and ensure the performance of assigned responsibilities as a project team leader, particularly on large-scale and complex projects.     Collaborative work with cross-functional teams within and external partners.     Develop and maintain relationships/partnerships with customers, stakeholders, peers, and partners to develop collaborative plans and execute projects.     Must have strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills.     Knowledge of project management best practices and processes.     Proficient in MS Office, MS Project, and other Project Management software (Project Management, Business, etc).         Qualifications:         Bachelors degree in a relevant field, and possession of a Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is mandatory.     Proven experience in project management, with a focus on leading a PMO.     Strong leadership and interpersonal skills.     Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.

Configure,      customize, and integrate Primavera Unifier according to business needs and      best practices. column2: Robotic Process Automation (RPA) Project Manager works closely with the overall Delivery lead, the RPA implementation team, and the customer, to automate, wholly, or in part, a set of processes as per the defined contractual commitments, using an approved automation product (such as UIPath).     The project manager oversees the planning, implementation, and tracking of the project to ensure the business outcomes are achieved and ensures handover to the run support team for effective ongoing   operational support.       Duties / Accountabilities :       Responsibilities include, but may not be restricted to :     Collaborates effectively with the Solution Architect to understand the contractual scope of work, the   milestones, the dependencies, and the customer responsibilities, the assumptions and risks associated with the defined solution, and creates a baselined work plan to implement and deliver the contracted scope of work.     Defines the organization structure and the roles and responsibilities for the staff on the project. Works with scheduling and resourcing teams to identify & onboard the staff needed to execute the work plan.     Ensures all project dependencies are met in a timely fashion. Some examples are:       Securing access ids to source applications     Ensuring development, test and production environments are available as per defined milestones     Availability of subject matter experts from the customers organization for design review and sign-offs.     Define the change management process to be implemented for the project, including     Identification and classification of change     Agreement with the customer to proceed with assessing the change for impacts to cost, schedule, effor and quality.     The process to approve and implement the change     Re-baselining of the work plan and budgets to include approved change requests.     Defines the issue resolution and risk mitigation strategy for the project, including escalation mechanism to the Customer and Vendor management.     Defines the communication plan for the project, including     Setting up a cadence for internal project meetings to monitor progress; identify, report and help resolve issues and mitigate risks.     Reporting project progress to the business owners and assuring the project is solving their problems and achieving their goals(within the framework of the defined scope)     Participation in any senior management review meetings     Executes the project as per the defined work plan, and within the approved budget     Ensures the project is executed as per the COE RPA Standards     Provides timely feedback for the staff on the project.     Ensures a smooth handover and transition to the Support team.             Education :       Bachelor/Masters university degree in Engineering           Required Key Skills :         10+ years of experience in information technology, including a minimum of 5 years of successful delivery of SI projects preferably in UiPath platform.     Experience in leading small teams having between 10 -20 team members     Fluency in English, both written and verbal essential     Excellent verbal and written communication skills/business writing skills, to be able to lead and drive discussions with the customers business and IT teams.     Good negotiation skills.     Experience in working with stakeholders both internal and external is essential.     Ability to escalate appropriately and to appropriate levels to ensure dependencies are met, or issues resolved to keep the project on schedule is essential.     Should have a good blend of Technology and Process knowledge     Should be proficient in creating WBS plan, Project Governance and tracking, Project Financials     Should be a good people person with the ability to work collaboratively with various team members             Desirable:         Prior experience in UI automation, Robotics process automation is required.     Working experience leading a global & cross-cultural workforce     PMP Certification

column2: This is an individual contributor role, responsible for SCM (Supply Chain Management) in the Project, reporting to the Regional Supply Chain Manager while supporting the project director. If you like complex projects, business challenges, have a curious mind, and have a problem-solving attitude, take the opportunity to join a World Technology Leader Company. Experience the great feeling from managing the SCM scope of large projects close to the end customer.           Your Responsibilities:           You will be part of the HVDC Project Core team for the projects you manage.          In this role, you will coordinate across multiple global regions with engineers, controllers, project planners, logisticians, quality professionals, buyers, and suppliers to ensure that equipment is procured and delivered on time, within budget, and within standard.          You will be responsible for ensuring that all key personnel within the project, global supply chain, the HVDC organization, and the client are aware of any risks to and opportunities within project supply chain.         During the project execution Project SCM need to ensure relentless execution with proactive planning and follow-up all equipment delivers with our suppliers and internal stakeholders. Project SCM to solve upcoming quality constraints or deficiencies with the supplier equipment deliveries.         Contributes to vendor list management by providing Supplier Performance data. Ensure that our suppliers comply with the laws, regulations, standards, certificates and directives that Hitachi Energy requires from their suppliers.         Living Hitachi Energy s core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business.               Your Background:           Degree in BE (Electrical / Mechanical) with preferably 8 -12 years relevant work experience. Demonstrated ability to manage the supply chain management needs of multi-million-dollar projects.         Ability to manage multiple priorities & proactively address business demands in a fast-paced environment.          Strong organizational and planning skills and the demonstrated ability to lead and manage projects.          Ability to prioritize and allocate resources to align with department and company goals.         Proven track record to deliver results and achieve goals.          You are used to a multicultural and challenging global business environment and can handle several tasks in parallel.         Preferred: CPSM or PMP certifications, Lean Six Sigma, SAP Experience, Documentation Management Systems, Power BI and proficient with Microsoft Office.          Excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to create strong working relationships.

column2: About OTSI: OTSI is a leading global technology company offering solutions, consulting, and managed services for businesses worldwide since 1999. OTSI serves clients from its 15 offices across 6 countries around the globe with a Follow-the-Sun model. Headquartered in Overland Park, Kansas, we have a strong presence in North America, Central America, and Asia-Pacific with a Global Delivery Center based in India. These strategic locations offer our customers the competitive advantages of onshore, nearshore, and offshore engagement and delivery options, with 24/7 support. OTSI works with 100+ enterprise customers, of which many are Fortune ranked, OTSI focuses on industry segments such as Banking, Financial Services & Insurance, Healthcare & Life Sciences, Energy & Utilities, Communications & Media Entertainment, Engineering & Telecom, Retail & Consumer Services, Hi-tech, Manufacturing, Engineering, transport logistics, Government, Defense & PSUs. Our focused technologies are: ??Data & Analytics (Traditional EDW, BI, Big data, Data Engineering, Data Management, Data Modernization, Data Insights) ??Digital Transformation (Cloud Computing, Mobility, Micro Services, RPA, DevOps) ??QA & Automation (Manual Testing, Nonfunctional testing, Test Automation, Digital Testing) ??Enterprise Applications (SAP, Java Full stack, Microsoft, Custom Development) ??Disruptive Technologies (Edge Computing/IOT, Block Chain, AR/VR, Biometric)  Website https://otsi-global.com/ Join us to engage in innovation, explore your ideas and expand your horizons. This position offers:             An environment that fosters continuous learning of new skills and technologies.         Opportunity to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses as we continue to release new capabilities for Dynamics 365 and Copilot.          Opportunity to work alongside the engineering team responsible for the design, development, and release of Dynamics 365.         Opportunity to help shape the future product roadmap.         Opportunity to lead diverse individuals and model, coach and care the team as a manager.              Required/Minimum Qualifications (From Role Library, plus any other HM-determined qualifications)                     Deep understanding and demonstrated hands-on experience of implementation, troubleshooting and supporting one or more of the Dynamics 365 products (Sales/Core Service/Field Service / Marketing) is a must Dynamics Customer Engagement (CRM).          3+ yrs. of people management experience          Passion for customers and focus on delivering the right customer experience.          Understanding of cloud computing technologies is highly desired - Azure Core Platform; Data Platform: SQL, Azure DB ; Application development experience; Power BI, PowerApps          Ability to learn new technology in a fast-paced environment          Desired B.S./B.A. Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or Equivalent Experience.          7+ years in a technical position with exposure to customer side troubleshooting          Passion for customers and focus on delivering the right customer support experience. Demonstrated skills and abilities to consistently create an engaging experience for our customers and Partners.          Program or Engineering management experience implementing cloud technologies.         Travel: Occasional travel is expected in this role.                     Responsibilities:             Directly manage the long-term support relationship with appointed Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement customers and resolve critical and complex technical issues in a 24x7x365 global support delivery team.          Lead diverse team as a people manager and coach/mentor employees and new hires.         Lead business operations to support customers 24x7 and collaborate with managers from other regions. column2: As a    product manager    in the HR Product & Analytics team   ,         You will be responsible for one or more end-to-end HR functional areas - for eg: performance management, compensation, learning, employee experience. You will help build process maturity roadmaps for these functional areas - progressing from isolated systems to connected intelligent systems. Your goal is to continuously eliminate operational / manual overhead of HR processes and look at how we can consistently leverage technology to improve efficiency and user experience     You would work closely and with great empathy for stakeholders ranging from employees, managers, leaders and of course the HR team. You are expected to go as deep as possible in understanding their pain points and partner with them in evolving the process / technology solution.     You are expected to map out the process and user journey for your areas - simplify and bring more structure and clarity to problem statements which translate into system solutions. Thinking from first principles is key here.      You should have strong systems thinking - understanding the impact of process / technology decisions and trade offs in order to achieve the best possible outcomes to solve the problem. You think holistically covering all aspects including edge cases and future possibilities     You should be abreast with the latest Innovations happening in the Employee Experience and Customer Experience Domain. Using these perspectives, you should be able to link with current pain points and conceptualize use cases / charters for the team     Be very hands on, curious to learn and develop a working knowledge of various HR systems - understand key workflows, configurations, data models etc. Go deep specifically in direct ownership areas.     Strong project / program management - You are expected to define requirements, scope and drive execution through various teams by setting up the right review mechanisms. You are expected to set up the appropriate agile methodologies within the team to drive execution. You will be supported by internal technical teams, operations as well as external partners for implementation.      You continually measure the success of your solutions basis stakeholder feedback, quantitative metrics and keep iterating and strive for customer delight             Ideal Candidate should have:       - Attention to detail, curious to dive deeper into problems, conscientious     - High analytical ability and quick with data reporting and analysis      - Working knowledge of HR systems, HR product-market knowledge (core HRIS and niche products)     - Fundamentals of HR processes, OD and design thinking     - Excellent communication skills to proactively communicate with stakeholders      - Ability to multitask and work on a diverse range of platforms and problems           -    1 to 3 years of experience in relevant roles - Product Management / Implementation in HR Tech Companies like Darwinbox, Rippling etc or Employee Experience / HR Transformation/ HR COE in product oriented companies like Amazon, Microsoft etc      - Tier 1 MBA and Engineering background, HR MBA is a ++, some prior IT/tech work ex is a ++

column2: A UI (User Interface) designer is responsible for creating and enhancing the visual and interactive elements of a digital product, such as websites, mobile applications, or software interfaces      They focus on designing the user experience and interface to ensure usability, accessibility, and overall user satisfaction      The primary goal of a UI designer is to create intuitive and visually appealing interfaces that enable users to interact with digital products seamlessly      The job description of a UI designer typically includes the following responsibilities:User Research: Conducting user research to understand the target audience, their needs, and preferences      This research helps in designing interfaces that meet user expectations and improve user satisfaction      Wireframing and Prototyping: Creating wireframes and interactive prototypes that showcase the layout, structure, and functionality of the interface      These prototypes help in gathering feedback and testing usability before the development phase      Visual Design: Designing the visual elements of the interface, including typography, color schemes, icons, images, and other graphical assets      UI designers focus on creating visually appealing and cohesive designs that align with the brand identity and target audience      Interaction Design: Defining the interactive elements and behaviors of the interface, such as buttons, forms, menus, navigation, and animations      UI designers ensure that these elements are intuitive, easy to use, and provide clear feedback to the user      Collaboration: Collaborating with cross-functional teams, including UX designers, developers, product managers, and stakeholders, to understand project requirements and ensure the design aligns with the overall product vision      Design Guidelines and Documentation: Creating design guidelines, style guides, and documentation that outline the design principles, visual standards, and interaction patterns to maintain consistency across different screens and components      Usability Testing: Conducting usability testing to evaluate the effectiveness and efficiency of the interface design      UI designers collect user feedback, identify areas of improvement, and iterate on the design to enhance the user experience      Stay Updated: Keeping up with industry trends, emerging design tools, and new technologies related to UI design      Continuous learning and staying updated on design best practices help UI designers deliver innovative and cutting-edge designs      In summary, a UI designer combines artistic and technical skills to create visually appealing and user-friendly interfaces for digital products      They work closely with other team members to ensure that the interface design enhances the overall user experience and meets the project requirements

column2: The Project Manager is responsible for leading teams to deliver project(s) that span across one or more business units. Manage resources, schedules, and adhere to stage gate quality and SDLC control guidelines throughout the full systems development life cycle. This also includes management of issues, risks and project change requests to ensure successful and on-time project delivery. Contribute to process improvement initiatives as it relates to improving project delivery. The Project Manager has the authority to run the project on a day-to-day basis. Verify that the project produces the required deliverables of quality, within the specified constraints of time and cost and to achieve the potential benefits defined in the business case. Responsibilities:-  Developing detailed designs. Doing feasibility assessments and site inspections. Preparing and implementing project plans. Researching and providing estimates for projects. Reviewing government regulations and      ordinances. Monitoring and optimizing safety procedures, production processes, and regulatory compliance. Project management duties (e.g. managing budgets, resources, and deadlines; acquiring and compiling quotes, etc.). Leadership skills to effectively manage a diverse group of professionals working on one project. column2: Project managers will work closely with Stakeholders and the Executive Council Team to make sure that the scope and direction of each project is on schedule. Project manager is also responsible for the direction, coordination, implementation, executive, control and completion of project, while remaining aligned with strategy, commitments and goals of the organization. Job Description: Planning Project Resources: Making a feasible plan that achieves the goals and objectives of the project and aligns with the organizations overall business strategy which is an integral and critical part of the pitch to get approval for the project. Part of the plan will also be to define the projects scope and determining what resources are available, estimating time and financial commitment, as well as how to monitor and report on the projects progress. Time Management: Ensure everyone is doing what they need to do when they need to do it, the project manager must also define, schedule and accurately estimate the task duration to develop and maintain a realistic schedule. Budget: Present an estimated budget for the project in line with the business goals. Next, the Project Manager must monitor the actual spend as compared to the planned budget. If those figures are off, it must be revised / adjust accordingly. Quality and Satisfaction: Deliver to your stakeholders what they expected or better and make sure that theyre satisfied with the results. Need to be in constant communications with Stakeholders, reporting on progress and being open to their feedback to keep them happy and coming back to you with future projects. Manage Issues and Risk: Problems will inevitably arise in a project. Thats called an issue. You need to be ready for them and work towards resolving them quickly, so as they don?? take your project off-track. Then there are risks, which are potential problems, ones that have yet to occur or might not ever. Regardless, you must figure out beforehand what the risks are and set in place a plan of action if they in fact occur. Monitoring Progress: To make sure a project is progressing as planned, you must constantly measure it and compare those metrics against the plan you created. Therefore, you must have a way to collect project data, such as status reports, to see if the actual progress of the project is meeting what you had initially planned. Things are going to change along the way, and you??e going to have to adjust or reallocate resources to accommodate these changes.  Reporting and Documentation: Reporting is one of ways you communicate with your team and stakeholders as they are looking for broader data to check the project?? progress, both are essential tasks for the project manager. This documentation, along with all paperwork, must be collected, signed off on and archived by the end of a project, which provides a history that you can revisit when planning for a similar project in the future.   Education & Experience: Engineering Degree in a construction-related field, such as building science, jetty, ports, bridges construction & management or civil engineering, as opposed to just having industry experience. Project management qualification - PMP certification is mandatory

column2: Org:Growth & Strategy (G&S) - Offering Development (OD) Role:Content Development Lead Industry X and Capital Projects Level:CL7 Manager Location:NCR | Bangalore | Mumbai About the Team At Accenture, we help transform leading organizations and communities around the world by serving 19 Industries across 5 Industry groups, 5 Functions, 5 Services and various strategic practices like Sustainability, Data & Applied Intelligence, etc. The role sits in G&S OD which is part of the Solution Development Hub that reports to Accenture's Chief Asset & Solutions Officer. Infrastructure & Capital Projects is a core solution within Accentures Industry X services, which focuses on applying digital and data to our clients Capital Projects portfolio. Clients come from many industries and are typically owner operators or EPCs.  Our strategic intent As part of transforming Accenture's GTM agenda and to be able to bring the best of Accenture to every client, every time and everywhere, we are building solutions, which are industry led, multi-service, asset-powered propositions, in digital format, anchored in our clients' most strategic and pressing issues. Our stakeholders are senior leaders within Accenture leading the industry, CALs and account teams who directly interface with our clients. We offer each talent an exceptional career experience by giving individuals the opportunity to inspire, innovate and make an impact for our clients, communities, and people. We are always looking for people to push themselves further, have the passion to collaborate, deliver value and help us reach our common goals. We seek exceptional Product Management professionals who help shape and maintain the future of Solutions tablets @Accenture and deliver outcomes to our clients. You are: Content Development Leads  have skills in content curation & development and storytelling. They apply agile ways of working to collaborate across the Accenture network to curate, develop and mature specific content for a multi-service solution. They ensure consistency and enrichment of solution content from businesses, markets, clients, partners, etc. to ensure value of the final product. They mitigate risks by ensuring the content meets the legal standards and requirements. Additionally, they may contextualize horizontal solutions for industries or functions. The Content Developer will be staffed to priority solutions teams based on skills and experience. The Content Developer must have relevant experience in Industry X and Capital Projects domain. Ideally a qualified civil engineer, site engineer or must have worked in construction or Engineering Procurement and Construction firms in the past. A complete understanding of capital build projects would help articulate the processes and nuances while working on the content for the relevant solutions. Qualification Key Responsibilities Responsible to curate, develop and mature content for majority or all of elements of solutions. Ensure consistency and enrichment of solutions through content from businesses, markets, clients, partners, etc. Contextualize horizontal solutions for industries or functions. Work with business stakeholders to incorporate innovation, client /CAL feedback, practitioner content. Adhere to solution tablet standards and agile solution delivery methods.  Partner with business stakeholders and SMEs to meet the needs of the target user personas, using a data-based approach to evolve the current solution. Work with the solution tablet team to identify risks, mitigation strategies, and quality issues as they arise. Required Work Experience & Skills 8+ years professional experience in the Industry X and Capital Projects industry or adjacent industries; with 2+ years of client facing consulting experience as a plus. Proven track record of working as a site engineer, civil engineer, or constructions site manager. Proven track record of working with Digital transformation or Digital technologies such as Control Towers, Digital Twins, Internet of Things (IoT) Proven track record working collaboratively with a multi-disciplinary team. Proven success guiding and partnering with multiple senior executives. Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills. High ability to adapt to dynamic and evolving business needs. Product Management experience and understanding a plus. Understanding of agile ways of working and storytelling a plus. Previous experience building compelling narratives out of existing materials a plus.  Previous experience in sales, proposal development, advertising, marketing, strategy, transformation a plus. For Internal Candidates only:Ability to work across multiple Services while harmonizing the value each brings to the Solution without bias (Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Operations, Industry X, Song) For External Candidates only:Ability to work across multiple business units while harmonizing the value each brings to the Solution.

column2: A Construction Manager (CM)  plays a crucial role in overseeing construction projects from inception to completion. job description (JD) for a Construction Manager: Position Title: Construction Manager Location: Baddi (Himachal Pradesh ) Overview: We are seeking a competent Construction Manager to oversee our construction projects. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in construction management, excellent leadership skills, and a proven track record of delivering projects on time and within budget. The Construction Manager will be responsible for managing all aspects of construction projects, including planning, budgeting, scheduling, and coordinating with subcontractors and other stakeholders. Note Must Require:  Experience in Civil and Mechanical Construction management. Responsible for creating Construction professional services (CPS), Bills of Quantities (BOQ), Construction plans, etc. Responsibilities: 1. Project Planning and Scheduling: Develop project plans and schedules in collaboration with project stakeholders. Monitor progress and make adjustments as necessary to ensure timely completion of the project. 2. Budget Management : Develop project budgets and monitor expenses throughout the project lifecycle. Identify cost-saving opportunities and implement strategies to stay within budget. 3. Resource Allocation : Coordinate with subcontractors, suppliers, and other resources to ensure timely delivery of materials and services. Allocate resources effectively to maximize productivity and minimize downtime. 4. Quality Assurance : Implement quality control measures to ensure that construction work meets industry standards and client expectations. Conduct regular inspections and address any issues that arise during construction. 5. Risk Management : Identify potential risks and develop strategies to mitigate them. Proactively address safety concerns and ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and standards. 6. Communication and Collaboration:  Maintain regular communication with project stakeholders, including clients, architects, engineers, and subcontractors. Foster a collaborative working environment to promote teamwork and project success. 7. Client Relations:  Build and maintain positive relationships with clients by providing excellent customer service and addressing any concerns or issues in a timely and professional manner. 8. Team Leadership:  Lead and motivate project teams to achieve project goals and objectives. Provide guidance, support, and mentorship to team members to help them succeed in their roles. 9. Documentation and Reporting : Maintain accurate project documentation, including contracts, permits, and change orders. Generate regular progress reports and updates for project stakeholders. 10. Continuous Improvement : Stay abreast of industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies. Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement innovative solutions to enhance project efficiency and effectiveness. Qualifications : - Bachelor's degree in  Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering , or a related field -  Proven experience in construction management, with a minimum of [10+] years of relevant experience. - Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and techniques. - Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. - Proficiency in project management software and tools . - Ability to multitask, prioritize tasks, and work under pressure in a fast-paced environment. Thanks & Regards Your Manpower Manager DIVYA SHARMA Contact No-8305735460 Officer- TA | HR Ashkom Media India Private Limited Website: www.ashkom.com

column2: Job Summary:   We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Project Manager to oversee our Transmission Projects in Dimapur, Nagaland. The ideal candidate will possess a Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering (B.E/B.Tech), along with a minimum of 12-15 years of relevant experience in the field. The primary responsibility of the Project Manager will be to ensure the successful planning, execution, and completion of 220/132/33KV Transmission Projects within the specified timelines and budget constraints. Key Responsibilities: Project Planning and Execution:  Develop comprehensive project plans, including scope, schedule, budget, and resource allocation. Coordinate with internal teams and external      stakeholders to ensure timely execution of project milestones. Risk Management:  Identify potential risks and challenges associated with the project and develop mitigation strategies to minimize their impact on project timelines and budgets. Contract Management:  Oversee the preparation, negotiation, and management of contracts with vendors, suppliers, and subcontractors. Ensure compliance with contractual      obligations and regulatory requirements. Quality Assurance:  Implement quality control measures to ensure that all project deliverables meet the required standards and specifications. Conduct regular inspections and      audits to monitor the quality of workmanship and materials. Resource Management:  Manage project resources efficiently, including human resources, equipment, and materials. Allocate resources effectively to optimize productivity and      minimize wastage. Cost Control:  Monitor project expenses closely and identify opportunities for cost savings without      compromising quality or safety standards. Prepare regular budget reports      and forecasts to track project expenditures. Stakeholder Communication:  Maintain open and transparent communication channels with project stakeholders, including clients, government agencies, regulatory bodies, and local      communities. Provide regular updates on project progress, issues, and      challenges. Health, Safety, and Environmental Compliance:  Ensure compliance with all health, safety, and environmental      regulations and standards. Implement appropriate measures to mitigate      risks and hazards in the workplace. Team Leadership:  Provide strong leadership and guidance to project teams, including engineers,      supervisors, and support staff. Foster a collaborative and inclusive work      environment that encourages creativity, innovation, and continuous      improvement. Qualifications and Experience: Bachelor's degree in      Civil Engineering  (B.Tech/B.E) from a  recognized institution. 12-15 years  of relevant experience in project management, with a focus on  220/132/33KV Transmission Projects. Proven track record of successfully managing large-scale infrastructure projects from initiation to completion. Strong technical expertise in transmission line construction, substation development, and related civil engineering works. Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. Proficiency in project management tools and software. PMP or PRINCE2 certification would be an advantage.

column2: The company is looking to recruit a skilled and experienced Project Management Team Lead to oversee candi s project management team        As the team lead, you will be responsible for managing project managers and ensuring the successful execution of projects from initiation to completion as per the defined PTO      Your role will involve providing leadership, guidance, and technical expertise to the team, as well as collaborating with cross-functional teams and external stakeholders to achieve project objectives      The ideal candidate will have a strong background in photovoltaic solar project management, excellent leadership skills, and a passion for renewable energy             Specifically, the job requires taking ownership of the following:                Project oversight            Review and sign off on several aspects of the project such as bill of material (BOM), project task order (PTO), variations requests, construction timeline, subcontractor payments, etc.          Manage, negotiate and enforce contracts with EPCs and any subcontractors, suppliers, and service providers to optimize the project costs, scope and timelines.          Ensure compliance with quality and EHS standards, regulations and requirements throughout the project lifecycle.            Team management:            Hire, lead and manage a team of project managers responsible for solar projects.          Provide leadership, guidance, and technical expertise to project managers.          Coach and mentor project managers to support their professional development and career growth.          Foster a culture of continuous improvement, innovation, and knowledge sharing within the project management team.            Stakeholder management            Foster positive relationships with stakeholders to support successful project outcomes.          Collaborate with clients, EPCs, and regulatory authorities to address project requirements and resolve any issues.          Communicate project updates to management and stakeholders            Performance monitoring            Develop monitoring and reporting frameworks tracking team and individual performance.          Control and enforce data hygiene and timely reports on project progress, variations and challenges.          Ensure timely and cost-effective project delivery in line with targets and objectives.          Identify opportunities for processes, methodologies and documentations optimisation.            Technical expertise:            Provide technical expertise and support to project managers, assisting with complex technical challenges, quality/EHS standards, design optimization, and troubleshooting.          Stay updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and regulatory changes relevant to PV solar projects.          Participate in industry conferences, seminars, and networking events to enhance industry knowledge and build professional relationships.              Job Requirements:                    B.Eng or M.Eng in Civil Engineering or Electrical Engineering or similar, with minimum 10+ years experience in the CI and Open Access solar space in India.          Management experience of an engineering team and a portfolio of projects          Proven track record of delivering projects on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.          Knowledge of solar technology, project financing, Energy Yield Assessment and regulatory requirements.          A dynamic personality, able to support with Project Development if needed, and liaise with various stakeholders          MSOffice, Google Docs/Sheets, Helioscope proficiency
