column2: The Project Manager oversees and manages domestic, regional, and/or global projects        Responsibilities typically include managing project teams, communications, risk, scope, schedule, cost, quality, and stakeholders effectively ensuring that variance from plan is proactively and effectively mitigated and client expectations are met The Project Manager is expected to have a working knowledge of IT solution development, solution deployment, data migration, solution retirement and/or IT infrastructure and IT cyber security      The Project Manager also compiles and drives documentation for the project, ensuring the accuracy and quality of regulatory data                 Summary of Responsibilities:          Project delivery        Responsible for project delivery with regards to agreed time, scope, cost, quality, successful outcomes, and project value      TEAM COMMUNICATION: Serve as key business/client contact for assigned project responsibilities, establishing working relationships with business/client project teams which result in business/client satisfaction, operational excellence and thereby increase potential for project ROI or repeat client business. Proactively identify and resolve conflicts as needed      For areas of project responsibility, lead core project team(s) and facilitate teams ability to lead extended project team(s), ensuring effective cross-functional teamwork among project team members including both internal and external stakeholders. Depending on size and scope of project(s), this job duty may be performed in collaboration with a Senior Project Manager and/or Project Director      Serve as escalation point for project issues, within area of project responsibility, to internal and external stakeholders, as appropriate      PLANNING: Create, maintain, and manage detailed Project Plans using approved PMO Tools; clearly articulating work breakdown structures of deliverables by phase, activity, and task; with role assignments and estimates to complete on each task      RESOURCE MANAGEMENT: Partner with resource managers and functional owners to identify all resources required to execute the plan, negotiate, and place resource requests and manage the resource plan for assigned projects      COST: Understand the project delivery strategy, costing assumptions and resulting budget for assigned project(s). Create and maintain project accounting records to accurately reflect, by month, by expenditure type and class; project spend-to-date, estimates to complete and estimates at complete; analyzing with explanation any variance between budget, plan, actuals and forecast.      SCOPE: Monitor project scope, schedule, and costs to ensure all remain on track with the contract and with financial performance targets. Initiate and implement appropriate actions to proactively manage the change control process both internally and externally      RISK: Proactively lead both quality control and risk assurance activities to ensure project deliverables are met according to regulatory and business/client requirements      QUALITY: Create and manage variance to required project plans. Per SOPs, implement and monitor progress against project plans and revise as necessary. Ensure that all staff allocated to assigned project(s) adheres to professional standards and SOPs, providing performance feedback to team member s respective supervisors. Ensure that projects are delivered meeting GxP Quality compliance rules and regulations as it applies to IT projects      Aid in development and maintenance of key project performance indicators, ensuring that the KPIs are within scope of the project charter/contract      Define and manage project resource needs and establish succession plans for key resources      Ensure that Steering Committee is established for projects and lead or co-lead the meeting with the business to ensure that leadership is kept appraised of status, upcoming activities, dependencies, risks, and roadblocks      Develop an understanding of Agile ways of working and Product mindset and assist in moving the organization towards adopting these ways of working            Business Development        In collaboration with relevant departments, support presentations for new projects and client business as required      Perform other duties as assigned by management            Line Management & Talent Development        Trains & mentor new Project Managers in multiple areas of expertise              Qualifications (Minimum Required):          University/college degree (Information Technology preferred) or certification in Information Technology (Fortrea may consider relevant and equivalent experience in lieu of educational requirements).                Experience (Minimum Required):              Minimum of five (5) years of relevant IT project experience in the IT Infrastructure and/or IT Cyber Security area with previous Admin experience in Cloud (Azure or AWS), Cyber, networking, server, voice, database, and/or data center projects.        Strong, presentation, communications and writing skills      Working knowledge of regulatory requirements and IT technologies for the related functional area.      Advanced computer skills (e.g., Microsoft Word, Excel, Project, and Power Point)      Experience managing projects in a matrix and virtual environment      Excellent communication, planning and organizational skills      Demonstrated ability to lead by example and to encourage team members to seek solutions independently      Demonstrated ability to handle multiple competing priorities and to utilize resources effectively      Demonstrated ability to inspire effective teamwork and motivate staff within a matrix system      Financial awareness and ability to actively utilize financial tracking systems      Working knowledge of project management processes and methodologies      Ability to work independently and mentor junior project team members      Ability to negotiate and liaise with business and clients in a professional manner      Ability to present to staff at all levels      Proactively identify and resolve conflicts as need                    Preferred Qualifications Include:            Master or other advanced degree      Certifications in Project Management, Program management, SAFE, Agile, Scrum      Global project management experience      Understanding of Agile ways of working and Product mindset preferred      Understanding of GxP Quality rules and regulations as it applies to delivering IT projects                Physical Demands / Work Environment:            No physical demands / work environment factors defined at this time

column2: Position: Project Manager  Experience: 10+ years in a PEB/EPC/PMC Contractor company. Location: Attivaram, Andhra Pradesh Job Summary: The Project Manager will be responsible for overseeing and managing projects from conception to completion. The ideal candidate will have over 10 years of experience in project management, with a proven track record of delivering projects on time and within budget. This role requires strong leadership, excellent communication skills, and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Key Responsibilities: Project Planning:  Develop comprehensive project plans, outlining scope, goals, deliverables, resources, budget, and timelines. Leadership:  Lead project teams, providing direction, support, and motivation to ensure successful project execution. Stakeholder Management:  Engage with clients, stakeholders, and team members to ensure project requirements and expectations are met. Risk Management:  Identify potential project risks and develop mitigation strategies to ensure project success. Budget Management:  Monitor and manage project budgets, ensuring financial objectives are met. Quality Assurance:  Implement and maintain quality assurance processes to ensure project deliverables meet high standards. Performance Monitoring:  Track project performance, providing regular status reports to stakeholders and management. Problem Solving:  Address and resolve project issues promptly, ensuring minimal impact on project timelines and outcomes. Documentation: Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including plans, reports, and records. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in project management, Business Administration, Engineering, or a related field. Minimum of 10 years of experience in project management, preferably in a PEB/EPC/PMC company. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification or equivalent is highly desirable. Proven track record of successfully managing large-scale projects. Strong understanding of project management methodologies and tools. Excellent leadership and team management skills. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Proficient in project management software (e.g., MS Project, Primavera). Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously. What We Offer: Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunities for professional growth and advancement. A collaborative and innovative work environment. The chance to work on high-impact projects with a dynamic team. Interested candidates can forward their CVs on ashu.mahendru@interarchbuildings.com

column2: SAP Project Planning   : Develop comprehensive project plans for SAP implementation, upgrades, or enhancements, considering project scope, timelines, resources, and budget constraints.       Stakeholder Management   : Collaborate with key stakeholders, including business leaders, IT teams, and external vendors, to define project objectives, requirements, and priorities.       Resource Allocation   : Allocate resources effectively to support SAP project activities, including project managers, business analysts, developers, and other team members.       Project Monitoring and Control   : Implement robust project monitoring mechanisms to track progress, identify risks and issues, and take proactive measures to ensure project delivery within scope, schedule, and budget.       Quality Assurance   : Define and enforce quality standards and best practices for SAP project implementation, ensuring adherence to industry standards and compliance requirements.       Change Management   : Facilitate change management processes to manage stakeholder expectations, mitigate resistance, and drive user adoption of SAP solutions.       Vendor Management   : Coordinate with external vendors and consultants to leverage their expertise, manage deliverables, and ensure alignment with project objectives.       Performance Reporting   : Prepare regular status reports, dashboards, and presentations for senior management, highlighting key project metrics, milestones, and risks.       Continuous Improvement   : Identify opportunities for process improvements, automation, and optimization within the PMO framework to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.       Team Development   : Mentor and coach project team members, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning within the PMO.       Requirements:         Education   : Bachelor s degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or a related field. Masters degree or PMP certification is a plus.       Experience   : Minimum 5+ years of experience in project management, with a focus on SAP projects, preferably in a large-scale enterprise environment.       SAP Expertise   : In-depth knowledge of SAP modules, such as SAP ERP, SAP S/4HANA, SAP BW/BI, SAP CRM, etc., along with hands-on experience in SAP implementation, customization, and integration.       Project Management Skills   : Strong project management skills, including project planning, risk management, issue resolution, and stakeholder communication.       Leadership Abilities   : Proven leadership experience in managing cross-functional project teams, driving consensus, and achieving project objectives in a matrix organization.       Communication Skills   : Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.       Analytical Skills   : Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyse data, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions to drive project success.       Change Management   : Experience in change management methodologies and techniques to facilitate organizational change and adoption of new SAP solutions.       Vendor Management   : Previous experience in managing relationships with SAP implementation partners, system integrators, and other third-party vendors.       Adaptability   : Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, adapt to changing priorities, and effectively manage multiple projects simultaneously.

column2: Job Description: Position Overview:  The Assistant Project Manager will be responsible for planning, executing, and finalizing projects within strict deadlines and budget constraints. This role involves coordinating the efforts of team members and third-party contractors or consultants to deliver projects according to plan. The APM will also define the projects objectives and oversee quality control throughout its life cycle. Key Responsibilities: Project Planning:       Define project scope, goals, and deliverables that support business goals      in collaboration with senior management and stakeholders. Team Leadership:       Direct and manage project development from beginning to end, providing      leadership and support to project team members. Resource Management:       Identify and manage project dependencies and critical path, ensuring      resource availability and allocation. Risk Management:       Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential risks, and      devise contingency plans. Communication:       Develop and deliver progress reports, proposals, requirements      documentation, and presentations to various stakeholders. Budget Management:       Estimate the resources and participants needed to achieve project goals      and manage project budgets. Quality Assurance:       Ensure that all projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within      budget while meeting the required quality standards. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Project      Management, or related field. Project Management certification is preferred. Minimum of 4      years of project management experience in the service industry. Proven ability to manage multiple projects      simultaneously. Strong familiarity with project management software      tools, methodologies, and best practices. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong leadership and team management skills. Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively. Experience in strategic planning, risk management,     and/or change management.   Why Join Us: Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunity to work with a dynamic and innovative team. Career growth and development opportunities. Positive and supportive work environment.

column2: Role & responsibilities     Develop and implement a change management strategy that includes the process, tools, and measurements to manage and track changes. Lead the Change Advisory Committee CAC meetings to assess, prioritize, and approve changes. Ensure all changes are documented, including risk assessment, impact analysis, and post-implementation reviews. Facilitate communication between IT, business stakeholders, and external partners to ensure clear understanding and expectations about changes.  Collaborate with IT project managers, system administrators, and developers to align on change schedules and resources. Provide training and support to IT staff and users on change processes and tools.  Monitor and report on the success of changes, identifying opportunities for improvement.  Stay informed about industry trends, tools, and technologies that can enhance change management processes. Develop deployment plans, schedules, and strategies in coordination with development teams, project managers, and stakeholders.  Identify potential risks and issues related to deployments and implement mitigation strategies to minimize disruptions to business operations Work closely with cross-functional teams, including development, testing, operations, and support teams, to ensure smooth and successful deployments.  Continuously evaluate and improve deployment processes, tools, and practices to enhance efficiency, reliability, and scalability. Schedule deployment calls and should be available in calls for proper monitoring. Preferred candidate profile     Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related field. Proven experience in IT change management, preferably in a financial services or NBFC  environment.  Strong understanding of ITIL frameworks and certification is highly desirable.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to interact effectively at all levels of the organization.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and projects.  Experience with change management software tools and methodologies.  Ability to lead and influence without authority and foster a culture of collaboration and continuous improvement.

column2: The PM role will coordinate technical requirements, drive SDLC stages, coordinate deliverables & resources, drive testing/release management, and ensure timely delivery of automation projects within Storage Infrastructure tower for efficiency & customer experience. The Storage infrastructure team manages the delivery lifecycle of infrastructure builds, configuration, capacity planning, monitoring, and provisioning services to fulfil data capacity demands of enterprise application teams. The automation is extensively used for delivering daily operations, embedding self-service, self-healing and programmatic interfaces, including deployment, upgrades, administration of Storage infrastructure, compliance, availability, and cost-effective data storage solutions.                   Roles and Responsibilities:                     Consolidate projects across leadership teams for unified view. Drive critical project engagements, publish status reports, and provide project updates in timely fashion.                 Partner with various teams and stakeholders to drive project governance & Operational readiness.                  Delivers the Storage automation initiatives to support the strategy and road map. Drives project delivery processes, demonstrating thought leadership, coupled with domain knowledge and technical savvy.                  Works with the Automation Product Owners (APOs to develop a prioritized feature backlog. Support product owners by ensuring backlog refinement and readiness.                  Understand team s technical platforms and applications. Facilitate solution technical alignment discussions.                 Ensure though testing through various phases (Dev, QA, UAT) and facilitate release management for error-free production deployment of code & capabilities for customers. Drive proper communication & change management.                 Facilitates project planning, review & update meetings along with automation developer resources. Ensures dependency alignment across initiatives. Collaborates with Automation Product Owners (APOs) to coordinate cross-initiative dependencies.                  Provides regular leadership updates on progress, raises impediments, handles risks, dependencies, and resourcing needs.                  Present Automation Scorecards as Outcomes & Benefits with data-driven insights into the project delivery and execution using relevant metrics.                  Manage complete SDLC phases of automation deployment, and drive CI/CD pipeline for software release. Use Agile methodology for faster & efficient code development.                 Ensure bug-free & best practices-based software solutions that are built using standard reference architecture, robust & resilient product designs, code development, testing & release management in Production.                 Execute Service delivery for projects to improve availability, reduce costs and enhance customer experience. Knowledge of ITIL based Storage Infrastructure support processes, including incident, problem, and change management is required.                 Note: Schedule may be a non-standard work week to ensure 24x7 coverage and work with extended teams across the globe.                                     Experience:                  Around 8 - 10 years of proven Software project management, delivery & release management. Knowledge of SDLC, AGILE tools/ methodology, CI/CD pipeline management, Rest APIs framework, and hands-on development experience with React/Node, Python, FLASK, Django, RDBMS is required. Preference given to candidates with experience of Infrastructure Automation delivery.                 At-least 5 years of technical project delivery experience with a demonstrated track record of growing responsibility. Experience in facilitating Agile, Scrum, or other rapid application development teams to deliver technology solutions on time, on budget, and to spec. Experience with design and coding across one or more platforms and languages.                 Understanding of Full Stack Software Development tools is a requirement that includes front-end software tools, including React/Node, backend Scripting, and good experience working with RDBMS like - SQL*Server, MySQL, PostGres DB.                 Additional weightage will be given for knowledge of PowerShell, and tools such as - .NET, IIS, HTML/PHP & BASH scripting.                 Preference given to candidates with good knowledge and understanding of Storage Technology landscape of industry products, in context of Dis-aggregated Storage & Software-defined Storage, Scale-out SAN / NAS / Object and Backup products.                                     Academic Background:                  Bachelor s degree in computer science, computer engineering, or other technical discipline, or equivalent work experience required; advanced degree preferred.                                      Behavioral Skills/Capabilities:                  Coach leaders and teams in Lean-Agile practices and mindsets. Live the Agile and SAFe Values and Principles.                 Ability to handle multiple tasks, set priorities, schedule, and meet deadlines (work under pressure and prioritize tasks)                 Ability to manage multiple priorities, make sound decisions, and maintain discretion and confidentiality of sensitive information.                 Excellent interpersonal skills including strong decision making, communications (verbal and written) and negotiation skills.                                     Enterprise Leadership Behaviours                  Set The Agenda: Define What Winning Looks Like, Put Enterprise Thinking First, Lead with an External Perspective                 Bring Others With You: Build the Best Team, Seek & Provide Coaching Feedback, Make Collaboration Essential                 Do It The Right Way: Communicate Frequently, Candidly & Clearly, Make Decisions Quickly & Effectively, Live the Blue Box Values, Great Leadership Demands Courage

column2: ARDEM Data Services is part of a US-based global professional services company providing Business Process Automation Services and Business Process Outsourcing Services. We have current job openings for Senior Project Owners (SPO) at our data processing centre to perform process and project management responsibilities. Responsibilities and Duties: Project Management: Manage and oversee multiple projects concurrently, ensuring they are completed within scope, on time, and within budget. Serve as the main point of contact for clients, maintaining strong client relationships, and understanding their needs and expectations. Team Leadership: Lead and manage a team of process associates, providing guidance, support, and mentorship to ensure project success. Assign tasks and responsibilities to team members, ensuring optimal utilization of resources. Quality Assurance: Act as a quality checker by reviewing work output and ensuring it meets established quality standards. Implement quality control processes and continuously seek ways to improve project quality. Process Improvement: Analyse existing data centre production processes to identify areas for improvement and increased efficiency. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement process enhancements. Workflow Development: Design and develop workflow processes for client assignments related to data processing. Create clear and effective work instructions for the workflow, ensuring that team members can follow them efficiently. Client Communication: Communicate with clients in English to thoroughly understand the scope of the assignment, project requirements, and deliverables. Keep clients informed about project progress, milestones, and any issues or challenges that may arise. Required Experience, Skills, and Qualifications Bachelors degree in College Degree with preferred degrees BTech, BCom, BSc, MCA, MBA. Proven 15+ Years of experience in project management, with a track record of successfully managing multiple projects concurrently. Able to handle 15-20 projects with team size of 1-5 Analysts, or a single project with team size of up to 30-50 Analysts. Able to plan daily work assignments for each team member. Able to supervise the individual project teams & train team members for each project. Able to create work instructions and process map for the workflow and keep them up to date. Able to create Processing Log sheet and keep it up to date. Able to create Processing Log sheet and keep it up to date. Able to create and keep updated HQC, DQC for project task tracking. Be able to communicate to the whole team in Team huddles and regular team meetings. Able to provide feedback and guidance to team members to help them improve their performance to achieve the project targets. Should have expert knowledge of input files and scope of customer work that we receive. Should have expert knowledge of how step by step the final output files are created and how they are delivered to our clients. Able to create Training Plan and Training checklist for the project and keep these up to date. Able to create Quality Plan and Quality Control Checklist for the project and keep these up to date. Able to create FQC checklist and use it to check client deliveries to assure 100% accuracy of delivered data. Should have understanding of Root Cause Analysis and Corrective Action. Should be able to Identify Early Warning Signs for team members and communicate the same to leadership. Should be able to propose corrective actions for performance or behavioural issues for team members. Able to provide reports related to project performance related to meeting delivery on-time, accuracy and cycle time objectives. Excellent in English communication. Have confident presence, presentation in video calls. Be able to work independently and directly with our customers. Hardware Requirements: Laptop: Screen Size:  14 Inches Screen Resolution:  FHD (19201080) Processor:  I5 or higher RAM:  Minimum 8GB (Must) Type:  Windows Laptop Software:  AnyDesk Internet Speed: 100 MBPS or higher

column2: We are looking for a dedicated and motivated IT Assistant Project Manager to join our team. This entry-level position is perfect for someone with 2 to 5 years of experience who is eager to grow their career in IT project management. Role & Responsibilities: Assist in planning, executing, and closing IT projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within scope, and within budget. Coordinate with project stakeholders to gather requirements, define project scope, and establish timelines. Monitor project progress, identify potential issues, and implement corrective actions as needed. Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including project plans, status reports, and meeting minutes. Facilitate communication between team members, stakeholders, and external vendors to ensure project alignment and progress. Assist in resource allocation, ensuring that team members have the necessary tools and information to complete their tasks. Conduct project reviews and create detailed reports for management. column2: Job description |  Project Manager (Remote) Position Overview:  We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced  Technical Project Manager to join our team. The ideal candidate will possess deep Project management experience, demonstrating a strong understanding of both technical and business aspects of software development. As a  Technical Project Manager, you will play a critical role in defining and executing the Project Timeline, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative solutions that drive business growth and enhance customer experience. Responsibilities:  Conduct project kickoff meetings to ensure a clear understanding of project goals and roles. Collaborate with stakeholders to define project objectives, scope, and deliverables. Develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation. Oversee the day-to-day execution of projects, ensuring adherence to project plans and timelines. Monitor project progress and identify potential risks and issues; proactively take corrective actions. Conduct regular project status meetings, providing updates to key stakeholders and management. Coordinate and allocate resources, including team members and external vendors, to support project requirements. Facilitate effective communication and collaboration among cross-functional teams. Develop project budgets and forecasts, closely tracking and managing project costs. Identify opportunities to optimize resource utilization and cost efficiency. Ensure the quality of deliverables through rigorous testing and adherence to quality standards. Implement proper documentation and version control practices for project artifacts. Maintain regular communication with clients, keeping them informed of project progress and managing expectations. Address customer feedback and concerns promptly and professionally. Identify potential project risks and devise risk mitigation strategies. Proactively manage project risks to minimize their impact on project outcomes. Conduct post-project evaluations to identify areas for improvement and lessons learned. Implement best practices and process improvements to enhance project management efficiency. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field. Minimum of 5 years of project management experience, specifically in software product development and implementation. Scrum certification (e.g., Certified ScrumMaster) is a good to have. Strong understanding of the project lifecycle, methodologies, and best practices. Excellent organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills. Ability to lead and motivate cross-functional teams effectively. Proficient in project management tools and software. Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and make data-driven decisions. PMP or similar project management certification is a plus. Location:  Remote Notes:  This is an individual contributor role. Please send in your resume to  abhijeet.singh@therealbrokerage.com

column2: Today, our civilisation stands at a critical juncture aswe are experiencing catastrophes like Climate Change and Global Warming, whichmight have adverse effects in the near future     In recent times, research indicatesnatural causes alone cannot explain the rapid increase in climate change     Theanthropogenic factor like burning fossil fuel, deforestation, and large-scalegrazing of livestock has resulted in this rapid change, as the majorcontribution to total radiative forcing is due to the increase in greenhousegases (GHG), namely carbon dioxide (CO2) and methane     Research indicates theimplications of climate change is not only restricted to environmental andglobal level but started showing consequences locally as well         The deserving applicant will be an integral part of Swanitisflagship programmes under Climate and Sustainability, founded on the beliefthat sustainable energy solutions need economic growth at the core     Our theoryof change centres on empowering states and districts to take charge of their sustainablefuture through bottom-up planning, community engagement, efficient utilizationof public funds, and strengthening governance mechanisms         By enabling a decentralised and participatory approach tosustainable development, the programmes aim to stimulate economic growth,reduce social inequalities, and foster environmental conservation byemphasising the principles of Just Transition, Net zero, economicdiversification, DRE-based solutions and citizen science                                         Roles and Responsibilities:                                     Ensure effective programme management by delivering appropriatetechnical, operational, financial and administrative outputs, while trackingthe programme progress through monitoring, evaluation and reporting. Project-related travel as needed, including for representing theteam and organization.                       Work on new initiatives, with grassroots partners, remote geographicalareas and rural communities. Skilled in developing quality reports and generatingknowledge products in the form of impact assessments and presentations,policy/programme briefs, and research papers for publications, baselineassessments, action planning, technology evaluation, and cost-benefit analysis.                                                   Technical and financial proposal writing skills.                           Benefits                At Swaniti, people remain the highest priority. Theorganization always prioritizes the well-being of team members while providingnew challenges to build professional caliber and most importantly createimpact.
